results.description:
Signing a Commercial Lease: What You Need to Know

Learn how to negotiate a fair commercial lease! Business owners know that securing the right commercial space is an important decision, but many are not prepared to enter the lease negotiation process. By effectively negotiating a lease agreement before signing it, small business owners can avoid costly mistakes in the future. This course offers useful steps you can take to prepare for negotiating a commercial lease that serves your interests and minimizes risks. The course instructors are attorneys who have counseled both landlords and tenants on lease agreements and can share practical strategies for success.

You will learn about:

How to negotiate your lease term and build exit strategies into the lease
How to avoid signing “form” leases that favor the landlord
What strategies you can use to limit personal liability
What to look for in the permitted use provision

RSVP

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/signing-a-commercial-lease-what-you-need-to-know-lower-manhattan-3316-registration-20025138729?aff=ccemail
results.name: Commercial Lease

results.description:
DACC Futurist Collectors,  


Let's hang out for an exciting and glamorous evening to get to know each other before DACC soft opening at the end of March 2016 (detail to announce very soon)! 

DACC private tour at 2016 Moving Image Fair + dinner in Chelsea!

https://vimeo.com/40836704

(Video resource: Moving Image Fair NY)

This is a fantastic networking opportunity, only reserved for a limited number of DACC members. Participating members get the chance to attend the opening reception of one of the most trendy and exciting art events in the Big Apple, visit the fair on a private guided tour, meet and network with the most active galleries, artists, events organizers and collectors in the world of art and technology!

To keep our group manageable, we can only offer up to 20 members' participation in the event. Book now!

Here is our action plan:

Time: March 3rd, 2016
Venue:
Waterfront New York Tunnel
269 11th Avenue
Between 27th and 28th Streets
New York, NY 10001

Detailed schedule

5:30pm - DACC members arrive at the fair entrance. 
We meet other members, check-in at the front desk to receive an information packet about the participating galleries, represented artists and scheduled events. 

6:00pm - We start sharp our 2-hour visit at the Moving Image Fair (the Fair only opens 2 hours on the opening evening)  

We will visit a group of selected galleries, meet with the gallerists, their exhibiting artist(s), learn about the digital art, the technologies applied to their works, and network at their booth.


8:00pm - Dinner (optional): 
After the fair closes, DACC members are free to choose to go out for dinner or go back home.


Midnight Moment (optional):
Midnight Moment is a long-term collaboration between Moving Image Fair and Time Square Art. One video from the 2016 Moving Image art fair will screen nightly on the 45-50 electronic billboards in Times Square for the month of March. All DACC members who are addicted to the nightlife of the Big Apple are welcome to celebrate this fantastic moment with the fair organizers, gallerists, artists and collectors in Time Square!

I look forward to meeting all of you at 2016 Moving Image Fair Opening!!

results.description:
Additional registration at Eventbrite REQUIRED!

Note: This is an exhibition opening with reception at the German Consulate. This event is not exclusive to our group. Please follow the Consulate's rules for registration. I (Thomas, your Organizer) will unfortunately not be able to attend, but the consulate has staff members on-site that can help & assist you.


After finishing your RSVP here, please proceed to

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/exhibition-opening-final-walk-headquarters-of-the-american-forces-tickets-21531222466


immediately to secure your spot. The Consulate's registration will close as soon as capacity is reached for this event.

FINAL WALK - Headquarters of the American Forces

About the exhibition

In 2012 & 2013 Sabine von Breunig had the privilege to take photos in the former headquarters of the American Forces in Berlin. Her photos are references to a past epoch, a final look back. In the exhibition at the German Consulate General in New York 40 photos will be on display from March 3 – April 15.

Sabine von Breunig works exceed the purely documentary. Her photographs make the atmosphere of the shown spaces perceptible, they impress by an artistic look, the subtle handling of light and the almost abstract appearing composition of color and structure.

The headquarters of the American Forces in Berlin was one of the hot spots of the Cold War. Here, history was made and substantial contributions towards international understanding and to the foundation of the Federal Republic of Germany were achieved. This was where General Lucius D. Clay initialized the famous Berlin ‚Luftbrücke’ with which 2 million citizens of Berlin were given necessary supplies from the air. US-presidents and famous decision makers visited the headquarters in Berlin, including President John F. Kennedy. His remarks made in berlin are legendary: “All free men wherever they may live, are citizens of Berlin, and therefore, as a free man, I take pride in the words: Ich bin ein Berliner!”

After the fall of the Berlin Wall, within the scope of the reunification of Germany, the allied sovereignty in Berlin expired on October 3rd, 1990, the era of the military governors came  to an end, and their administrations closed down. After nearly 50 years of residency, the Americans handed their headquarters back to the German Federal Republic.

The area has been lying idle since 1994 and has only been sporadically used as backdrop for Hollywood film productions. “Inglorious Bastards” starring Brad Pitt and “Operation Valkyrie” with Tom Cruise were shot here.

In May 2011, the five hectar property was sold for 15 million Euros to an investor and the seven for-preservation buildings were remodeled into luxury flats and the signs of history vanished.

About the artist

Sabine von Breunig attended the master class of Prof. Arno Fischer, Berlin. Her work has been shown in Berlin, Köln and New York. Her book ‚Geisterstadt’ (ghost town) was published 2012 by Edition Braus/Aufbau Verlag  and in 2014 it was nominated for the Photobook Prize of the Börsenverein des Deutschen Buchhandels.


Ongoing Exhibition:

Thursday, March 3, 2016 – Friday, April 15, 2016

Opening hours: Monday – Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Admission is free.


Opening reception:

Thursday, March 3, 2016 from 6:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m.


Admission

Admission is free for this event, but your registration at 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/exhibition-opening-final-walk-headquarters-of-the-american-forces-tickets-21531222466

 is required to gain access.

How do I get there by subway?

6: 51st St

4/5/6/7: Grand Central Terminal

E/M: Lexington Av/53rd St

Since the event is near 1st Ave & 49th St, there is going to be a bit of a walk involved, keep that in mind for your timing & check google maps for details. 


I will not be able to join this event or assist you with access on-site, please don't forget to register at Eventbrite (see link atop) for guaranteed access. 


And - as always - change your RSVP status if your plans change. We appreciate it very much!


Thomas

results.description:
Please join us for an exciting evening to learn more about Real-Time stream processing with Apache Flink from Jamie Grier who is Director of Applications Engineering at data Artisans.


RSVP Details: You must have your full name as it appears on your ID on your meetup account to pass beyond building security. Guests must join the NYC Apache Flink Meetup.


Sponsor: McKinsey & Company 

Schedule: 

6:00 pm - 6:30 pm : Networking, pizza and drinks 

6:30 pm - 6:45 pm: Flink Community Update by Slim Baltagi

6:45 pm – 8:00 pm : Talk by Jamie Grier

Talk description:  In this talk Jamie will be delving further into the recent work he’s done with Apache Flink which resulted in the recent blog post published on February 2nd, 2016: “Extending the Yahoo! Streaming Benchmark and Winning Twitter Hack-Week with Apache Flink”


Jamie will go through some comparisons between Storm (and other systems like it) and Flink both in terms of processing guarantees and performance.


 He’ll also talk about some of the new architectural patterns that can be realized via a modern stateful stream processing system like Flink and what kind of advantages these patterns provide.


Bio: <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/slimbaltagi"></a>Jamie Grier is Director of Applications Engineering at data Artisans where he’s extremely excited to be able to help others realize the potential of Flink in their own projects.  His goal is to help others design systems to solve challenging problems in the real world.Jamie has been working in the field of streaming computation for the last decade.  This has spanned everything from ultra-high-performance video stream acquisition and processing to social media analytics.

Prior to joining data Artisans, Jamie was at Twitter working on rethinking the real-time analytics stack with the goals of making it much more efficient and also capable of computing accurate results in real-time without relying on the “Lambda Architecture” for correctness.

Jamie is interested in streaming computation and mechanically sympathetic software architectures.  He is particularly interested in building systems that are both high performance and highly scalable and his favorite quote is “You can have a second computer once you’ve shown you know how to use the first one”

results.description:
Share a Stitch

So whomever wants to share a stitch they are jazzed about let me know and and come prepared to demonstrate and laugh out loud while we stitch ourselves into a frenzy trying out your shiny new toy. 

Help, I'm stuck!

So there's this project we all have that would be totally perfect except there's one part of it that is an infernal nuisance and has us stopped in our tracks. Help a sister out. Calling all stitching ninjas! 

Let's put our heads together and help make one more great embroidery or needlepoint happen in this world. One question a member please, and let's vet them beforehand so there are no repeats.

Best Stores Ever

Ok, I am asking  you to divulge trade secrets. You know,  that PLACE that has that STUFF you can't get anywhere else and for such a bargain! Come armed with all the information we may need to go on our very own stitching supply safari.  Who knows? this topic just screams FIELD TRIP to me.

Along the same lines, member Kim Kotary has suggested a supply swap. Items bought, and shunted aside for something even more fabulous and are just sitting there making you feel like a Imelda Marcos or someone in need of an intervention. Stay Tuned - Kim has kindly offered to spearhead her nifty thrifty idea.
results.name: Share a Stitch - Help, I'm Stuck! - Best Stores Ever

Hi All


THIS PAGE HAS IMAGES,  if you do not see them and you are viewing this page with

1)  the Meetup App - click the "DESCRIPTION TAB"

2) Android - open your browser's settings menu and click ''REQUEST DESKTOP SITE". 

3) Apple IOS - click the "DESKTOP SITE" button at the bottom of the page.

4) Microsoft Windows - buy a new computer :)

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I never take myself this seriously 

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required.

results.description:
This is more of an FYI- Im unsure if I will be able to attend.


The Trials of Muhammad Ali

A new film and discussion series at the Newark Museum kicks off with a screening of The Trials of Muhammad Ali. Prior to the screening will be a gallery talk in the exhibition Wondrous Worlds: Art & Islam through Time and Place.

The evenings are designed to encourage conversations that deepen understanding of the ways that Islamic faith and culture have impacted the everyday life of Muslims across the world and throughout the ages.

The discussions begin at 6 pm and are followed by the screenings at 7. 

Gallery talk will be led by Fazilla Mahmood and Arif Uddin, two Newark Museum Explorers who are juniors at Science Park High School and St. Vincent Academy. Following the talk will be a screening of The Trials of Muhammad Ali by Bill Siegel.

The film examines how one of the most celebrated sports champions of the 20th century risked his fame and fortune to follow his faith and conscience.

The evening will conclude with a Q and A session with Mustafa Abdul-Baatin, wh co-founded and served as president of the Muhammad Ali International Corporation;and Jeff Diamant, scholar-in-residence at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.
results.name: Gallery Discussion & Free Screening: The Trials of Muhammad Ali @ Newark Museum

THIS IS A JOINT MEETUP WITH NYC APACHE FLINK MEETUP.  PLEASE MAKE SURE TO INCLUDE BOTH FIRST & LAST NAMES ON RSVP AS HOST SECURITY TEAM IS REQUIRING BOTH.

ALSO PLEASE RSVP ON NYC APACHE FLINK MEETUP SITE SO WE HAVE ONE CONSOLIDATED LIST HERE

Extending the Yahoo! Streaming Benchmark & Winning Twitter Hack-Week with Flink


Please join us for an exciting evening to learn more about Apache Flink from Jamie Grier who is Director of Applications Engineering at data Artisans. Sponsors: TBD


Schedule: 

6:00 pm - 6:30 pm : Networking, pizza and drinks 

6:30 pm – 8:00 pm : Talk

Talk description: In this talk Jamie will be delving further into the recent work he’s done with Apache Flink which resulted in the recent blog post published on February 2nd, 2016: “Extending the Yahoo! Streaming Benchmark and Winning Twitter Hack-Week with Apache Flink”


Jamie will go through some comparisons between Storm (and other systems like it) and Flink both in terms of processing guarantees and performance. He’ll also talk about some of the new architectural patterns that can be realized via a modern stateful stream processing system like Flink and what kind of advantages these patterns provide. Bio: Jamie Grier is Director of Applications Engineering at data Artisans where he’s extremely excited to be able to help others realize the potential of Flink in their own projects. His goal is to help others design systems to solve challenging problems in the real world.Jamie has been working in the field of streaming computation for the last decade. This has spanned everything from ultra-high-performance video stream acquisition and processing to social media analytics.

Prior to joining data Artisans, Jamie was at Twitter working on rethinking the real-time analytics stack with the goals of making it much more efficient and also capable of computing accurate results in real-time without relying on the “Lambda Architecture” for correctness.

Jamie is interested in streaming computation and mechanically sympathetic software architectures. He is particularly interested in building systems that are both high performance and highly scalable and his favorite quote is “You can have a second computer once you’ve shown you know how to use the first one”
results.how_to_find_us: 52ND STREET BTWN PARK & MADISON AVE
results.name: Extending the Yahoo! Streaming Benchmark & Winning Twitter Hack-Week with Flink

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Thursday March 03,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.

This is a fully hands on class. Just connect your Arduino and we will walk through example code together. This class will focus on getting you up and running with Arduino quickly, so that you can begin to explore the world of Arduino on your own.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCqFHuyT7qc

This class will be run using the Basic Kit by Sain Smart which can be purchased for $25.00, so you can continue to work on  projects at home.  See below for details.

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!

results.description:
As entrepreneurs, one of our biggest challenges is building a product or providing a service that truly solves a problem or a need. In our previous meetups we have talked about the idea of Lean Startup, and how important it is for entrepreneurs to utilize. Now we are proud to bring in the next presenter in our Entrepreneurial Deep Dive series Alex Britez, who will delve deeper in to this topic and demonstrate how he utilizes Lean Startup, design thinking, and many other problem solving frameworks to build and innovate for Macmillan Learning.

This is a must for just about any entrepreneur!

Alex Britez has a background in design, engineering and educational learning theory. As the Director of Digital Innovation at Macmillan Learning, he is leveraging his broad skill set and experience to help the organization accelerating it's learning, reduce risk and identifying opportunity. Part of this success has been through meticulously introducing a much more consumer centric approach to product development. Inspired by the Lean Startup movement, Design Thinking, and several other problem-solving frameworks, he has designed various tools to help create a process that is both flexible and repeatable. This has resulted in a positive shift in culture, where ideas are placed in front of customers quickly, and the learning loop starts almost immediately.

During this session, Alex will introduce how he runs Product Design Sprints at Macmillan Learning. Design Sprints have been a hot topic, sparked by the talented individuals at Google Ventures, that combine pieces of agile, lean startup and design thinking. He will take us through each of his 6 phases, and share some interesting tools that have helped him along the way. It doesn’t matter if you work for a small start-up or a large enterprise organization. Design Sprints offer a host of benefits for either.


Schedule:

6:30 - 7:00: Food and Networking
7:00 - 8:00: Presentation
8:00 - 8:30: Q&A and Discusion
8:30 - 9:00: Additional Networking and Wrap Up

How to find us:

results.description:
The Life We Bury, by Allen Eskens Sometimes telling a story is all about retelling—tracing the thread of a long-ago series of events and finally getting it right. Minnesota student Joe Talbert discovers this when he is tasked with writing a senior citizen’s biography for a college English class. Short on options and time, Joe heads to Hillview Manor nursing home in search of potential subjects. There he meets Carl Iverson, a dying Vietnam vet who’s out on parole after serving a 30-year sentence for the rape and murder of 14-year-old Crystal Hagen. Joe dreads writing his story: “I had come to Hillview looking for a hero, and instead, found a villain.”

But the man whom his research reveals is far from a one-dimensional bad guy. Joe meets Carl’s army buddy, Virgil, who witnessed Carl’s acts of heroism and insists that his friend is no killer. Then Joe spots a telling detail from an old crime scene photo—one that was overlooked at the trial. He begins to suspect there’s much more to the story than the secretive old man is telling him. But if Carl didn’t murder Crystal, why did he never proclaim his innocence? What really happened to him in Vietnam? And is the real killer still walking free?

Joe turns amateur sleuth, aided by his attractive but standoffish neighbor, Lila. Then his mother is jailed for DUI, leaving him to care for his autistic brother. As his search for clues becomes more dangerous, he begins to wonder if he’ll have to choose between college and the claims of family. Allan Eskens’ compulsively suspenseful first novel reveals that guilt takes many forms—and that getting the story right is essential.(bookpage review)

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. results.description:
A provocative and penetrating investigation into the rivalry between Alexander Hamilton and Aaron Burr, whose infamous duel left the Founding Father dead and turned a sitting Vice President into a fugitive.
In War of Two, John Sedgwick explores the long-standing conflict between Founding Father Alexander Hamilton and Vice President Aaron Burr. A study in contrasts from birth, they had been compatriots, colleagues, and even friends. But above all they were rivals. Matching each other’s ambition and skill as lawyers in New York, they later battled for power along political fault lines that would not only decide the future of the United States, but define it.
A series of letters between Burr and Hamilton suggest the duel was fought over an unflattering comment made at a dinner party. But another letter, written by Hamilton the night before the event, provides critical insight into his true motivation. It was addressed to former Speaker of the House Theodore Sedgwick, a trusted friend of both men, and the author’s own ancestor.
John Sedgwick suggests that Hamilton saw Burr not merely as a personal rival but as a threat to the nation. Burr would prove that fear justified after Hamilton’s death when, haunted by the legacy of his longtime adversary, he embarked on an imperial scheme to break the Union apart.
John Sedgwick is a journalist, novelist, memoirist and biographer who has written or co-written numerous books ranging from his psychological thriller, The Dark House, to his multi-generational family memoir, In My Blood. He has also written many articles for GQ, the Atlantic, Newsweek, Vanity Fair, and other magazines
Thursday, March 3, 2016 - 6:30 PM
| Open to the Public | Members' Room
| $10 with advance registration, $15 at the door
[masked]
results.name: John Sedgwick, War of Two: Alexander Hamilton, Aaron Burr, & the Duel Host: Mila

results.description:
A prompt is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!
results.name: WRITING PROMPTS w/ Jim

results.description:
Join us for this class on HTML and CSS aimed at beginners with no or little experience in programming. This class provides a full introduction to the building block of every website, HTML (the content of a site) and CSS (used to style websites including colors and fonts). In this class, you will leave with the ability to create a basic web page and an understanding of the fundamentals of programming. 

Key Takeaways:
• General overview of programming
• Learn basic techniques and concepts used for website development
• Learn how HTML and CSS work together to create richer online experiences
• Create a basic one-page website with images, content, custom fonts and colors
• We’ll provide you with available resources if you’d like to continue learning 

Prerequisites and Preparation:
1) Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook).
2) Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).
3) Light snacks will be provided.


*This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in our immersive program.
results.name: HTML & CSS for Beginners

group.name: Dev Bootcamp NYC Events and Workshops

results.description:
Greetings! We have a new free  Spanish class for beginners: Greetings and Basic Instructions: Saturday Mar 3, 6:30-9:00 PM. 

Join us if you want to learn the basics. Learn how to introduce yourself, telling our name and asking other ones their names and last names. Introduce where are you from and ask where the others are from. Learn the Spanish Alphabet and the numbers from 0 to 20. Learn the very basic survival instructions to communicate with natives. ( I don’t understand, repeat please, What does it mean, Can you spell it?…) Learn some basic cultural tips about Hispanic Countries.

There'll be people that are not from meetup.com, you won't be alone. Please note that Free spaces are limited. Paid attendees will have priority access. Please reserve only if you'll be able to make it.


This is another class of our series of single day S.O.S. Spanish workshops designed to help you out with the basics asap. If you'd like to continue your learning after these sessions, you can continue on to our 20 hour beginner course. (not free). Or join any other of the S.O.S. Workshops. (view more here)

These lessons are purposely made at a classroom setting as a way to intensify your initial learning of the most needed topics. Classes will include videos and role playing. Some of the most popular lessons are:

See you then!

Learn Spanish New York
51 W14TH ST, Suite 3R. 
New York, NY 10011
(between 5th and 6th avenues)
Tel,[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: between 5th and 6th avenues
results.name: Spanish for Beginners - FREE

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
The adage goes: Love where you live, invest where is makes $en$e.

How do you find the right market? What markets have the best opportunities? This month at the LI Multifamily Investor Group, we will dive into what to look for in an apartment market.  Register now to claim your seat. We will discover:

• How the apartment market selection process works

• Which demographics to focus on, and which to disregard

• How to leverage industry professionals to get inside market intel

The demand for apartments continues to climb, and there is a shortage of workforce housing.  Now is the best time in history to own an apartment building. Don’t wait until the historically interest rates start to climb.

Let your multifamily investment property build equity while you sleep, the ultimate combination of cash flow and principal paydown.  We are helping our clients stack stable assets for the future with multifamily real estate. Come and find out how investing in multifamily real estate can help you create a legacy for your family.

Make sure that you register by clicking here. This meeting is $25.

In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Powerful and swift, these evil shape-changers roam the land at will, murdering those who oppose them and plundering the weak. At the head of this pack paces the great Black Wolf of the wood. results.description:
At some point, everyone wants to get away...to travel, see' new things, meet new people, get to know a new side of YOU. 

With GET AWAY as the theme, #EvolutionOpenMic  will touch on that, with the help of the night's #AscendedArtists  who know thing or two about traveling: The Bi-lingual hip hop duo, Negros Americanos  (Mcenigma Lyle and Jordan Fields )

SHOWTIME: 7PM to 9PM 

*List opens for sign ups at 6:30PM--- 20 SLOTS ONLY!!!

* one piece limit for poets, singers, and emcees. 5 minutes for other performers.

Kween Moore of Urban Kween Brand will present the #CanvasOfResource

 for us to fill up with our musings through paint.

* $5 cover plus donations

. 


ABOUT THE SHOW: 

EVOLUTION is about pushing through the comfort zone and into the unknown, for individuals must go beyond remedial to truly say they are grown. This combination open mic/ discussion forum is a safe space for all races, genders, sexual preferences, spiritual backgrounds, and art forms. Attendees will be presented a theme each week to engage as an artist and/or spectator. Part training ground, part chill spot, EVOLUTION only grows as a platform for expression so long as the people grow by using it. Risk must be taken here, if only to show others, and ourselves, what is still needed to 

#EVOLVENJ

.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This will be the Republican Debate.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.
results.name: Presidential Debates Viewing Party & After Work Happy Hour 2nd Floor at St Pat's

results.description:
(Click to See the Picture) The above advertisement that was published in 1958 rings more true today than maybe it was back then. If you are a start up or a service based business, getting the attention of your ideal client and have them listen to you and your message are more difficult than ever before. 

It's not as easy as placing an ad on Yellow Pages anymore. With 100s of choices to choose from to market your business, where do you start ? 

And most importantly how do you know which one will yield better results than other channels? 

Everyday, business owners battle with tons of marketing choices and endless questions  such as; should I blog? should I have a social media  page? which social media channels should I be on? do I need a new website? how do I get more customers through online marketing? do i need a new app for my business? etc. etc. 

Out of all of this noise, how do you decide what will help you get consistent leads (potential customers who are interested in your product or service) which turns into paying clients? 

That's what we will talk about in this meet up event.

Not only will this be a class on lead generation, it will also be an opportunity brainstorm about your business and ask questions. 

Looking forward to seeing you all.
results.name: How To Generate Consistent Leads and Sales For Your Start Up or Service Business

group.name: New York Lead Generation and Marketing Automation Meetup

results.description:
There once was a time when I was starving in my intimate relationships. I found myself stuck in karmic loops; repeating the same patterns of behaviors that blocked the intimacy I craved to nourish my heart, mind, and soul. I was addicted to the drama and didn't even know what true intimacy tasted like— it became a fantasy I chased. 

I was chasing what was inside of me. The magic of looking within, created the life I wanted to live. 

We pass the knowledge, wisdom, and tools we have learned in our upcoming workshop: Drama Interrupted: Get Raw In Relationship 

Do you know yourself? Do you know how to deeply connect with others? If not, what blocks that connection?

Socrates says, "Know thyself"

Access the power of your voice, experience more confidence in your actions, and clear the blocks so you can have fulfilling relationships. This workshop asks you to examine more closely your relationship with yourself and others, your understanding of intimacy and ways to awaken in your life through intimacy. Communication. Vulnerability. Honesty. 

All are necessary components to know the self. Drop the superficial drama & the saga of your stories so you can get more real and raw. Feel the depth of another when you learn to honor the depth within yourself.

Unveil the potent self through somatic intelligence meditations, psychodrama and group exercises to connect more deeply & honestly within relationships. 

And that is just the beginning... Limited to 25 participants. All are welcome— including singles & couples!

___________________

Drama Interrupted: Get Raw In Relationship

What you will get out of it: Discover how the 5 senses play a role in the way you relate to the self

Access greater depths of connection Reunite with your internal voice

Build confidence in your sexuality

Rewire limiting stories & beliefs about the self

Feel more alive

Cultivate better attention Get in touch with your power Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/drama-interrupted-get-raw-in-relationship-tickets-21596360295 

Tickets are $30 at the door & $25 online! Space is limited to 25 participants so we suggest getting them online ASAP while they are still available.

 ___________________

Schedule 7:00 PM Doors open
7:00 — 7:15 PM Registration
7:15 — 9:15 PM Workshop
9:15 — 9:30 PM Wrap up & questions

___________________

The last workshop was amazing. We had 13 Sexual Alchemists. Here are some testimonials from the workshop: 

“It was a great workshop, I learned a lot about my myself—interactive action part was the best!” J.W. 

“A safe cocoon was created—very well done.” L.S. 

“I liked the workshop and felt like I took a lot away from it” S.W. 

“I really liked the meditation & psychodrama.” E. K. 

“I really liked how Edy held and guided the room, she was like a teacher & I found it easy to listen to her. Leah felt very soft & nurturing— I found myself feeling her presence.” J.A. ___________________

A little bit about us (the organizers): Edy is a visionary, seeker of truth, and master of creating a safe space. She gracefully infuses her vast knowledge of human psychology, alchemy, and sexuality with her therapeutic skills. Through psychodrama and storytelling, Edy untangles personal myths that interrupt the potency of your sexual self. Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MA, LCSW, CST

Leah holds the paradox of deep wisdom and playfulness. She uses creative life coaching games to reveal the truth behind the illusion and chaos of our lives. Her dynamic, gentle, and magical spirit guides others to access power in intimacy and relationships. Certified Life Coach
results.name: Drama Interrupted: Get Raw in Relationship

results.description:
The NYC Junto will meet on Thursday March 3, 2016 at the General Society Library, 20 West 44th Street. The open discussion will begin at 7:00 PM and the featured speaker begin at 8:00 PM. This event is free and open to the public. 

The featured speaker will be Gregory F. Rehmke, who will speak on the topic of economic freedom and its benefits. Mr. Rehmke is the Program Director for EconomicThinking.org, a Teaching Fellow at the Independent Institute, and has directed educational programs at the Center for the American Idea, Reason Foundation, and the Foundation for Economic Education. He co-authored of The Complete Idiot’s Guide to Global Economics.

Founded in 1985, the NYC Junto is a monthly meeting hosted by Victor Niederhoffer, who is a quantitative hedge fund manager, former world #1 squash player, and the author of The Education of a Speculator. Junto meetings are moderated by Barron's columnist Gene Epstein and Niederhoffer. Meetings occur on the first Thursday of each month.

You are invited to subscribe to the Junto newsletter at NYCJunto.org and connect with the NYC Junto on Twitter, Meetup, and the Podcasts app.

Related Links
https://www.facebook.com/events/125640371155743
twitter.com/NYCJunto
twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer
DailySpeculations.com
Junto podcast: https://itun.es/us/oQ4F0.c
results.name: Greg Rehmke will speak

PURCHASE YOUR TICKET THROUGH ALLEYNYC OR YOU WON'T HAVE ACCESS

Our conversation series actively celebrate individuals who are redefining what it means to be an artist and an entrepreneur.

On this night, join us for a one-on-one with Phillip Krim (CEO of Casper) and Luke Sherwin (CCO ofCasper) 

We'll touch upon:

- The story of  the Casper founding team and what sparked the idea

- Their branding and creative flow

- The evolution of their idea and bringing the product to market

- How they decided on which prototype to launch with

- Their process for innovating on their entire customer experience

- The design focus of the brand's story and direction

and more.......

Moderated by: Nsi Obotetukudo (COO of Alley)

Casper was created because better sleep makes for better living. Casper is constantly innovating sleep research, products, and services because they believe it their mission to help everyone achieve their best life possible. 

Liquor generously provided by our friends at Hooch

Wine generously provided by our friends at Cloud No. 9

Cider generously provided by our friends at Down East Cider (so that you'll really sleep good tonight)!

We'll meet on the northeast corner of the LIC Sports Field (46th Rd. and 5th St.) at 7:00pm for our 4ish mile loop around LIC. You can run at your own comfortable and totally non-competitive pace and know that we'll never leave you behind. 

We usually head to the pub for beverages and/or snacks afterward - Bring some cash if you would like to participate in our post-run social time. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 5 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. Please be prompt.

 As always, if you have any comments, ideas or suggestions, please let us know!

results.description:
THIS IDEA MUST DIE: Scientific Theories that are Blocking Progress,                  John Brockman, Ed.

Each year, John Brockman, publisher of Edge.org—”The world’s smartest website”—challenges some of the world’s greatest scientists, artists, and philosophers to answer a provocative question crucial to our time. 

In 2014 he asked 175 brilliant minds to ponder: What scientific idea needs to be put aside in order to make room for new ideas to advance? Dawkins and Pinker head the list, while Geoffrey West challenges the concept of a “Theory of Everything” and Alan Guth rethinks the origins of the universe.—Paper, Kindle, Audio

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!
results.name: SHSNY Book Club: "This Idea Must Die"

group.name: Secular Humanist Society of New York

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com
results.name: FREE Coed Dodgeball & Bar Party! Upper East Side - Soft safe jello balls

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This will be the Republican Debate.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

results.description:
https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/0_xTM_kBMvdKw4e7Ny_J1F9cHiBBuwT2fBiyCfam4LG-22cM5K_mutkftA0Uzd7bfbx1REsz7pKqQpNoOGCS1NeEopX_AdKjsKGKTp7Trq8OzPfhmv1RkyUUqFN1PgiWA9o=s1600

Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change, and Adam Wozney, Community Manager at Wix Lounge, on Thursday, March 3rd for a FREE workshop on Personal Branding with Purpose: Communicate Your Passions, Talents, and Impact for Career Success.

======================================

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCpbMar3**

=======================================


Developing a personal brand - creating your image and guiding your reputation - has never been more important. Whether you’re seeking to move up in your organization, looking for a new job, thinking about making a career change, launching a new business, wanting to attract new clients, or looking to scale your social impact, in today’s rapidly-changing, hyper competitive working world a strong and consistent personal brand is key to creating new opportunities for your career or business.

The truth is we all have a personal brand. It is how we are perceived by others - our friends, colleagues, and the public. It is what people think about when they hear our name and what people say about when we are not in the room. The key question we need to ask is: do we take charge of our personal brand or do we leave it up to chance?

Personal Branding with Purpose is not about learning how to "create" a personal brand. It's about learning how to live your personal brand by sharing your authentic self and communicating clearly the value you can provide others. Our passions, talents, and impact are unique gifts we can give to the world. By learning how to market these gifts through personal branding, you create not only career and business opportunities but also a greater capacity to make a difference in the lives of others and the planet.

======================================

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCpbMar3**

=======================================

* Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An understanding of personal branding- how you can leverage it to create new career and business opportunities as well as scale your impact

• Gain greater clarity about your passions, values, purpose, and career goals that serve as a foundation for an authentic personal brand

• Define your Big Idea - what you stand for - and integrate it with your unique knowledge and experience to communicate your brand value

• Identify your niche, target audience and articulate how you can help solve problems they have

• Assess and strategically build your online identity and presence|

• Develop strategies for maintaining and adapting your personal brand in a world of constant change

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Professionals looking to create new career and business opportunities

• People seeking a new job or looking to make a career shift

• Entrepreneurs wanting to increase their own visibility to grow their businesses

• Creatives and service providers (consultants, coaches, agents, and speakers) wanting to attract new clients and business opportunities

• Students or recent grads looking to build a foundation for their future career path

INSTRUCTOR BIOS

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/dPMORfsoT-skXzhCGXDz03AQ5I38N3d7Y_zCIWvJo5djoMDjHSPBhqF888uRxwFC1gnPjdhLjxbyoKp-TPdnpUpbHQ39TbaOAGXfyKRLDy8IfBXQYjJU4Il43OBrgREUCpA=s1600

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach,consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/HD25gIEoxR8ARXSbtTZ_fSeOL7BaHYH78kCKHtWSdoGtnojLmn5pxSSLpxlmK5RsWpc-zC1dQCWYqX9CWGwr17VM5MBE0QQs5orLRU3vKn0HG5LLuSAP712g6YB3AQwJYuw=s1600

Adam Wozney manages small business partnerships and events at Wix.com. He works out of Wix’s Wix Lounge, a free co-working and event space for small businesses, creatives and various industry professionals.

He specializes in strategic partnerships, experiential marketing, and community management. He is also a freelance digital marketing expert and amatuer rock climber with a passion for civic engagement.

For more info on Adam check out the below social links:

Twitter: @AdamDeanWozney

Snapchat: Splince

Instagram: Splince


THANK YOU TO OUR PARTNER  

</a>

<a href="http://www.wix.com/">https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/k2IwnGFFFp6XhIEb_V6h4DZn3TLgRYjLIe_fvPhoiZOO9CJgdDKDQF-CfbQljv2zJ4-WLP_OfEH06_I4HywDPncGIPPaviPsrf0LMYvLD5E2Q8d5e2YJ-QitPpuuqbTA=s1600

Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.


So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

results.description:
THIS IDEA MUST DIE: Scientific Theories that are Blocking Progress,                  John Brockman, Ed.

Each year, John Brockman, publisher of Edge.org—”The world’s smartest website”—challenges some of the world’s greatest scientists, artists, and philosophers to answer a provocative question crucial to our time. 

In 2014 he asked 175 brilliant minds to ponder: What scientific idea needs to be put aside in order to make room for new ideas to advance? Dawkins and Pinker head the list, while Geoffrey West challenges the concept of a “Theory of Everything” and Alan Guth rethinks the origins of the universe.—Paper, Kindle, Audio

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!

results.description:
IN A DARK DARK WOOD - Ruth Ware

What should be a cozy and fun-filled weekend deep in the English countryside takes a sinister turn in Ruth Ware’s suspenseful, compulsive, and darkly twisted psychological thriller.

Leonora, known to some as Lee and others as Nora, is a reclusive crime writer, unwilling to leave her “nest” of an apartment unless it is absolutely necessary. When a friend she hasn’t seen or spoken to in years unexpectedly invites Nora (Lee?) to a weekend away in an eerie glass house deep in the English countryside, she reluctantly agrees to make the trip. Forty-eight hours later, she wakes up in a hospital bed injured but alive, with the knowledge that someone is dead. Wondering not “what happened?” but “what have I done?”, Nora (Lee?) tries to piece together the events of the past weekend. Working to uncover secrets, reveal motives, and find answers, Nora (Lee?) must revisit parts of herself that she would much rather leave buried where they belong: in the past.

In the tradition of Paula Hawkins's instant New York Times bestseller The Girl On the Train and S. J. Watson’s riveting national sensation Before I Go To Sleep, this gripping literary debut from UK novelist Ruth Ware will leave you on the edge of your seat through the very last page.
results.name: March 2016 - IN A DARK DARK WOOD

results.description:
There once was a time when I was starving in my intimate relationships. I found myself stuck in karmic loops; repeating the same patterns of behaviors that blocked the intimacy I craved to nourish my heart, mind, and soul. I was addicted to the drama and didn't even know what true intimacy tasted like— it became a fantasy I chased. 


I was chasing what was inside of me. The magic of looking within, created the life I wanted to live. 

We pass the knowledge, wisdom, and tools we have learned in our upcoming workshop: Drama Interrupted: Get Raw In Relationship 

Do you know yourself? Do you know how to deeply connect with others? If not, what blocks that connection?

Socrates says, "Know thyself"

Access the power of your voice, experience more confidence in your actions, and clear the blocks so you can have fulfilling relationships. This workshop asks you to examine more closely your relationship with yourself and others, your understanding of intimacy and ways to awaken in your life through intimacy. Communication. Vulnerability. Honesty. All are necessary components to know the self. 

Drop the superficial drama & the saga of your stories so you can get more real and raw. Feel the depth of another when you learn to honor the depth within yourself.

Unveil the potent self through somatic intelligence meditations, psychodrama and group exercises to connect more deeply & honestly within relationships. 

And that is just the beginning... 

Limited to 25 participants. All are welcome— including singles & couples!

___________________

Drama Interrupted: Get Raw In Relationship

What you will get out of it: Discover how the 5 senses play a role in the way you relate to the self

Access greater depths of connection Reunite with your internal voice

Build confidence in your sexuality

Rewire limiting stories & beliefs about the self

Feel more alive

Cultivate better attention 

Get in touch with your power 

Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/drama-interrupted-get-raw-in-relationship-tickets-21596360295 

Tickets are $30 at the door & $25 online! Space is limited to 25 participants so we suggest getting them online ASAP while they are still available.

 ___________________

Schedule 7:00 PM Doors open
7:00 — 7:15 PM Registration
7:15 — 9:15 PM Workshop
9:15 — 9:30 PM Wrap up & questions

___________________

The last workshop was amazing. We had 13 Sexual Alchemists. Here are some testimonials from the workshop: 

“It was a great workshop, I learned a lot about my myself—interactive action part was the best!” J.W.

 “A safe cocoon was created—very well done.” L.S. 

“I liked the workshop and felt like I took a lot away from it” S.W. 

“I really liked the meditation & psychodrama.” E. K. 

“I really liked how Edy held and guided the room, she was like a teacher & I found it easy to listen to her. Leah felt very soft & nurturing— I found myself feeling her presence.” J.A. ___________________

A little bit about us (the organizers): Edy is a visionary, seeker of truth, and master of creating a safe space. She gracefully infuses her vast knowledge of human psychology, alchemy, and sexuality with her therapeutic skills. Through psychodrama and storytelling, Edy untangles personal myths that interrupt the potency of your sexual self. Clinical Social Work/Therapist, MA, LCSW, CST

Leah holds the paradox of deep wisdom and playfulness. She uses creative life coaching games to reveal the truth behind the illusion and chaos of our lives. Her dynamic, gentle, and magical spirit guides others to access power in intimacy and relationships. Certified Life Coach
results.name: Drama Interrupted: Get Raw In Relationship

THIS EVENT IS NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR MEMBERS OF ANY PARTICULAR POLITICAL PARTY, IT IS OPEN FOR ALL TO ENJOY.  Our gathering is first and foremost a Happy Hour for people to come together and socialize.  Secondly, it is a great way for everyone to keep tabs on all the current candidates and thirdly a great way to see the debate if you don't have access to the channel it is on that night!!   Arrive at 6:30pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors. This will be the Republican Debate.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Join us at Genspacefor another lecture presented as part of the KNow Scienceseries. KNow Science is an international education and advocacy organization working to promote knowledge of science and scientific research to a non-specialized audience. Dr. Natalia Freund will discuss her work as an HIV scientist at Rockefeller University and the future of HIV research and treatment. 


The fear surrounding the HIV/AIDS epidemic, which emerged in the 1980s, persists today. Once HIV is transmitted through body fluids, it attacks our immune system and gradually depletes our immunity causing acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) and if untreated, death. In 2014, according to the World Health Organization, 35 million people worldwide were living with HIV, with 2 million AIDS-related deaths occuring every year. An extensive research of HIV infection and pathogenesis led to the development of drugs that can hold back the disease, but once infected with HIV, a person can never be cured. What are the chances of achieving HIV eradication and an AIDS-free world? 

Dr. Natalia Freund is an HIV scientist at Rockefeller University who has been carrying out cutting edge research on immune response during HIV infection. Her main focus has been antibodies that can neutralize the virus and reduce levels of HIV in the body. Before coming to Rockefeller, Dr. Freund conducted her BSc and PhD studies in Tel Aviv University, where she investigated new vaccine strategies to HIV and other viruses and volunteered in the Israeli AIDS task force. With over ten years of HIV research she is passionate about her work and excited about delivering her knowledge to the public. When away from science, Dr. Freund is a devoted mother of three, a book and art fan and an enthusiastic traveler.
results.name: Hidden Inside the Cell: HIV and the Threat of Viruses

results.description:
Dear friends,

The popularity of our presidential candidate, Bernie Sanders, keeps steady in the country, after Super Tuesday.

We, as Latinos, now face the challenge of enthusiastically exerting a greater effort to ensure our community supports Sanders and that he wins the elections.

Our group was created in August with the twin objectives of: disseminating Sanders' message within New York City's Hispanic community and of organizing a grassroots movement supporting specific parts of his agenda which strongly resonate with us.

We are inviting Latino leading organizers and volunteers from each county in the Metropolitan area and the suburbs to share their experiences in order to develop strategies and an interaction to build up a common front, enriching our possibilities of winning the primaries in New York.

It will be a pleasure to work together for the benefit of our community and to get Bernie elected President.
results.name: Latinos for Bernie organizing strategy in NYC

results.description:
Join us at Genspace for another lecture presented as part of the KNow Science series. KNow Science is an international education and advocacy organization working to promote knowledge of science and scientific research to a non-specialized audience. Dr. Natalia Freund will discuss her work as an HIV scientist at Rockefeller University and the future of HIV research and treatment. 

The fear surrounding the HIV/AIDS epidemic, which emerged in the 1980s, persists today. Once HIV is transmitted through body fluids, it attacks our immune system and gradually depletes our immunity causing acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) and if untreated, death. In 2014, according to the World Health Organization, 35 million people worldwide were living with HIV, with 2 million AIDS-related deaths occuring every year. An extensive research of HIV infection and pathogenesis led to the development of drugs that can hold back the disease, but once infected with HIV, a person can never be cured. What are the chances of achieving HIV eradication and an AIDS-free world?

 Dr. Natalia Freund is an HIV scientist at Rockefeller University who has been carrying out cutting edge research on immune response during HIV infection. Her main focus has been antibodies that can neutralize the virus and reduce levels of HIV in the body. Before coming to Rockefeller, Dr. Freund conducted her BSc and PhD studies in Tel Aviv University, where she investigated new vaccine strategies to HIV and other viruses and volunteered in the Israeli AIDS task force. With over ten years of HIV research she is passionate about her work and excited about delivering her knowledge to the public. When away from science, Dr. Freund is a devoted mother of three, a book and art fan and an enthusiastic traveler.
results.name: Inside the Cell: HIV and the Threat of Viruses

results.description:
So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
Ever thought of writing your own apps for Android devices?  Well there are lots of hard ways and one easy way.  Come learn the easy way using a program called Mintoris BASIC.  You will learn how to read the sensors on your device, communicate with laptops and arduinos using Bluetooth, create displays and user interfaces.  A few android devices will be available but it would be best to bring your own.

Reviews from our previous courses:

• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.

About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211
