results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

results.description:
Hello DreamBuilders! 

Join me and other DreamBuilders at the 4th Vision Workshop armed with paper, a pen, an open mind and a desire to manifest amazing growth and change in your life. 

The Vision Workshop: 3 Keys to Accelerating Your Success, utilizes effective success-building strategies and common universal principles to reveal the methods required to move beyond inertia, take action, and build a richer, fuller life.

You will learn how to use the three fundamental steps to success (creating a clear vision, changing limiting beliefs, and overcoming the biggest obstacles) in this thought-provoking and fun workshop. You’ll walk away with tips, techniques, and practical advice for implementing these critical strategies in order to create an action plan for success, and achieve amazing results in the four domains of your life: health and well-being, relationships (in the broadest sense), time/money freedom, and your career/creative expression. The workshop is also interactive and you will have an opportunity to work with a partner to begin to envision and articulate a specific dream or goal.

Whether you’d like to create a better work/life balance, take action on creating healthier lifestyle, or find or mend a relationship…this workshop is for you!

To Your Success!

Chris

results.description:
Hi LGBT History and Culture!

Join us for this meetup at a queer solo performance piece with live music, titled SKIN, a week from Thursday on March 3 at 7:30 at the beautiful Theater at the 14th Street Y.


What is SKIN about? Here's our synopsis:
Two things threaten Marais’ dissertation on Virginia Woolf: her hot new girlfriend and her own dark past. Confronted by echoes of sexual trauma in Woolf’s work, Marais races to write her own way into a happier future. She’d give body and soul to claim a love greater than any she's known before. But after you learn to guard against life, can you open again? Trigger warning: brief descriptions of sexual violence.

SKIN is a frank and funny collage on sex, danger, Virginia Woolf and the transformative power of art. Tickets on March 3 are just a suggested donation of $15, with a talkback and reception to follow, and proceeds will benefit the Fund for a Safer Columbia (FSC). The March 3 presentation of SKIN is actually being co-sponsored by Columbia Pride, as well.


I imagine you may have heard about Emma Sulkowicz's inspiring Carry That Weight mattress project last year, and the student activism that sprang up around it. The FSC was founded when activists started running into costs that outpaced their personal finances (like when they delivered 28 mattresses to Columbia's president and were charged for their disposal).


Here's the Facebook event page for the SKIN benefit, where you can learn more about the show: https://www.facebook.com/events/952631481484770/


Tickets can be reserved by emailing [masked]

Thanks so much for any support!
I look forward to hearing from you soon!

All our best,
the creative team of SKIN
results.name: SKIN-A Lesbian Play With Music on Sex, Danger, Virginia Woolf & the Power of Art

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will be led by meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp and include guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
For week 3 (march 3rd) We will be on Studio 402, this studio will be on building 500 (NOT building 519 like last class). Full address below.

Our Level 1 Salsa class on Thursdays is a success. We have an average of 23 students and everyone is progressing at a normal pace. Week 3 (March 3rd) is the final day for people to join this 12 week cycle. After But we will only accept ladies. why? because there is only limited space and we already have the number of guys we need. We have enough ladies but we are looking to have a 1:1 ratio of male:female or close enough. There are two ways ladies are eligible:

1) Come to the La Fama Salsa social on Friday Feb 26th and take the complimentary class. the party is is $10 but once you are in, the class is no extra charge. That will allow you to catch up to where we are on the Thursday class. Link for info about La Fama Practice party:

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228673203/


2) If you cannot make it to the La Fama special class, learn the basic step and the right-turn on your own by watching these videos:

basic step:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eCAb4eR5lOg

Right-Turn:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xaJSnz1kEoo

If you learn these two steps by this coming thursday (March 3rd) then you can come to the Thursday class cycle and continue to learn with the rest. In fact, we will be giving a short review of the right turn so at the very least, learn the basic step well and feel free to come to the thursday class.

Join our facebook group for music, videos, questions/answers, and general class info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue, 4th Floor (Btwn 35th & 36th)

Room: Studio 402 (4th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only).

Time: 8pm-9:30pm.

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (open house - anyone can join)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (semi open house - only those who know the material taught on weeks 1 & 2 can join. A special class will be offered for those who want join the cycle and need to catch up)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (closed - no new students accepted)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn

Week 7 - 12

More fundamental footwork and partnerwork
results.name: Week 3 - Level 1 Salsa Class Cycle (March 3rd)

Please, read carefully before you RSVP!!

This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

Level description:

We will practice mostly the basic sentence structure using proper particles. Basic action verbs, verb conjugation, present tense, and pronunciation & speaking. You must know Hangul and can read/write comfortably

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.

results.description:
If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcomed!


This meetup is perfect for:
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation
-New arrivals to the U.S.
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing
-Weather
-Hobbies
-News
-Politics
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

This venue has food such as pastas, salads and sandwiches ($4-$8)
They also sell Beer, coffee & normal drinks for very cheap! ($2-$4)

results.description:
We all know the term "Law of Attraction." But, what is it, really? How does it work? And, what practical place does it have in day-to-day life?

The purpose of this group is to answer these questions, as well as bring like-minded people together to form a network of support in living with clear intention. You'll learn about the Universal Laws and Abraham Hicks' processes and practices. This will help you shift your energetic vibration, align with your higher self and empower you to deliberately create a life you love.

Coming together as a group to do this type of work is incredibly powerful. This is truly our life's work, and committing to our lives in this way is not only transformational for us. It's transformational for those around us.

$20

Please register at: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=231300&stype=41&sTG=53&prodId=10271

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Open House! Community Potluck & Hot Seats

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]
results.name: Futsal on Thursdays Midtown/8:15pm

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein thou hast done foolishly: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.” (2 Chronicles 16:9 KJV)

ATTENTION ALL MEMBERS OF THE CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA.

All members of the national organization of the Christian Party of America are invited to attend the monthly “Members Only” Conference Call via Skype.  If you are already a member of the national organization, you can obtain the call-in information by emailing the National Chairman Clell Drumheller at [masked].  If you are not yet a member but would like to become a member, you can find out how to join and obtain the membership forms at http://christianpartyonline.com/wp/join-the-party/

So members Please join us at the Christian Party of America’s monthly Members Only Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Clell Drumheller, National Chairman of the Christian Party of America and Texas State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Every quarter the National Executive Committee will hold its business meeting during the call and members are invited to observe the Executive Committee meeting on those occasions.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide members only Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other members of the Christian Party as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

“11 Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.12 For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places.13 Wherefore take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand.” (Ephesians 6:11-13 KJV)
results.name: MEMBERS ONLY CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Join us for our twice-monthly meditation group! We've found that it's nice to have an environment where everyone can relate and feel comfortable because we've all had similar experiences of anxiety.

We meditate together, discuss ways to apply meditation principles to work more skillfully with our anxiety, and support each other by listening and sharing our experiences (only if you want to!).
results.name: Meditation Group for People with Anxiety

results.description:
Hey Guys, We will be meeting at McAleers Pub on Amsterdam and 80th first You will see an organizer with a BIG MEETUP Sign. if you want to go to the Singles show at Stand UP NY after free of charge we will go if not you do not have to. Stand Up New York is one of the hottest comedy clubs in New York city is doing a Singles Mixer where drinks are half price at the bar, And on top of that giving Free tickets if you want to see a Comedy show (you do not have to stay for the show) Where top comics from across the country discuss relationships and dating etc. this should be an amazing meetup, You do not have to be single to come and enjoy it and you do not have to stay for the show if you do not want to, if you do stay for the show its a 2 drink minimum in the showroom as any show. Hope to see you there. 

The Mixer is at the bar, there will be an organizer and the bartender is aware of the meetup so just let the bartender you are with meetup, there will also be a meetup sign. The line up is: Host Jared Freid (MTV) brings you Ryan Reiss (Comedy Central), Chris DiStefano (MTV Guy Code), Andrew Schultz (MTV Guy code) and some more will be added

Heres some info on the show: Stand Up NY have brought onboard Total Frat Move‘s Jared Freid for a comedy event unlike any other. Stand-up comedy at its finest with some of the best young comics out there! You’ve seen them on MTV’s Guy Code, Girl Code, Funny Girls, IFC Benders, Conan, and many more!

College student/teacher? Even better! Bring your ID for a reduced rate and drink specials all night. We know college is hard and we know it’s expensive, we have you covered!

Jared is a Total Frat Move contributor for their blog and podcast, The JTrain Podcast, hosted by Stand Up NY Labs. He has been featured on Tru TV’s “NFL Full Contact,” MTV’s “Failosophy,” and more recently on AXS TV’s “Gotham Comedy Live.” He is also a writer for TotalFratMove, BroBible, and HeTexted. Each week you can find a new original column on TotalFratMove.com and his dating advice column on PostGradProblems.com. In addition to writing, he is also the host of the JTrain Podcast and the creator of the “Frat Dude Goes To” series where he travels the country interviewing “Bros” at wild events like the Carolina Cup and the AVN Awards. Follow him on twitter @JTrain56 for all of his weekly content.

Want to see more of Jared, well then we’ll see you Thursday at 9:00 PM, only at Stand Up NY!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Beyond Adventure is raising the bar with luxury slope-side (true ski in/ski out) accommodations at JAY PEAK (with a hot tub!!).

--News and updates: 


Jan 11:  The meetup had some leftover money from Stowe to help subsidize a trip to Jay Peak

Mar 31: Contacted Donna on VRBO for 5BR 4BA duplex condo with hot tub.  But got confused, lost my chance for the weekend.  Someone else scooped it up.


Sep 7: Contacted Matthew on VRBO for 3BR 3BA duplex with hot tub.  Haggled with me and about charging more for not having children.  So weird!


Oct 5: Contacted John on VRBO for 4BA 4BA duplex with hot tub.  Ignored for a few days and tried again.  Scheduled someone else for that weekend.  Grr!


Oct 12:  Contacted Matthew again and saw that my weekend was still open and the "pay button" was activated.  Paid in full for 8 persons and sent a note that I will only put light/petite women in the bunk room.  He sent me a strange reply but accepted my offer.  Yay!


Oct 13: Revised the event but closed RSVPs, as I need to confirm women for the bunk room.  There are only 3 slopeside properties on VRBO with a hot tub, so owner's can be picky because demand is high.  The condo can easily support 12 persons.  So send me a PM if you want to join.  This trip will be epic!

 Nestled in the Northeast Kingdom of Vermont, Jay Peak is famous for it's aerial tram, gladed ski runs and the Jay Cloud, a phenomenon responsible for an average annual snowfall of 377 inches, the most snow in eastern North America.  In 2012, known as the worst snow season in the NE, the Jay Cloud made an appearance, dumping 50 inches of snow in 3 days!  Watch what that was like here: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-P9GWowIUqs

Imagine the convenience of true ski in/out lodging where you no longer need to load up the car, wait for it to warm up, locate a parking spot and walk to the lift.  Fifteen feet from the front door, you just swoosh down the Grammy Jay trail to the Village lift.  Achieving first chair is no longer a contest, as you are making tracks before the lifts are even spinning!  And forget about selling your firstborn for lunch on the hill.  Just come back to the condo, warm up and make yourself a sandwich.

  And did we mention, this property has a hot tub????


Of course if conditions for skiing and snowboarding are not up to par, you may find your thrill at the Pump House at the base of Jay which is the second largest indoor waterpark in the country.  In addition to rivers, slides chutes, indoor and outdoor hot tubs, they also have a flowrider (simulated surf park).  Watch it here:


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlPa6PU0L1A


Cost (lodging & food)

SUPER  Early Bird (till November 15, 2015) $199+ $6 PayPal fee


Regular (till Jan 31) $275+ $8 PayPal fee

Late (Feb 1 or later) $325+ $10 PayPal fee

Payment can be made by PayPal.  If you don't have a PayPal account linked to your bank account, please include the fee.  If you have a PayPal account linked to your bank account or Chase QuickPay, you can send me money without the fee.  My PayPal and QuickPay account is [masked].  Please only use PayPal if you have an account connected to your bank and send money to friends & family, otherwise there is no benefit as PayPal adds its transaction fee.  You can also mail me a check (PM me for my mailing address) or give cash if you see me.  Previously I used WePay which charges more than twice as much as PayPal!

Lift Tickets must be purchased separately.  A 3 day pass at the ticket window currently sells for $217, but there may be opportunities to get it cheaper such as Liftopia.com


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cvJwxi6niiA

 

Transportation: We will carpool. Jay Peak is a 7 hour drive from NYC. As we get closer to the event I will put up a ride share Google sheet.  Check the updated carpool policy as it relates to sharing expenses: http://www.meetup.com/Beyond-Adventure/messages/boards/thread/30374572

Rental Equipment: There are various shops to rent equipment in and around Jay Peak.

Other Activities: Besides the indoor water park, there is also a nordic center for cross country skiing and public skating at the Ice Haus Skating Arena.

Food: We will shop Thursday and Friday nights at a local supermarket with the Beyond Budget :)  This will pay for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Beer may be included if we are beyond enough.

Accommodations:

One of the the best luxury 3 bedroom/3 bath condos on the mountain.
Enjoy the two floor living on the mountain with direct ski in/ski out access to the Grammy Jay trail through the back sliding door. When you come back from the long day on the mountain, grab a beer and relax in the 6 person hot tub out the back deck with friends.  Two master suites with King size beds and a bunk room has 2 sets of bunk beds.  Each living room has a queen sized pull out couch.  Keep all your gear out of sight and organized in the gear room downstairs.


The Townhouse comes will a fully equipped kitchen, linens, pillows, blankets are also provided. A washer and dryer are also provided.

Other Amenities

Two floors, granite counters, stainless steel appliances. Radiant heating on bottom floor and also in ski room to dry your boots, mittens, and hats.  Hot tub brand new seats 6 people. Unit is level no stairs to climb, ski right out onto slopes, outdoor ski locker

Parking for 2 vehicles.  Additional cars can be parked at the Stateside Lot.

Wireless internet

RSVP: First come, first serve.  The organizer will give room assignments.

Please answer ALL of the RSVP questions to help coordinate rides.  A Google sheet will be posted here once RSVPs start coming in.


Suggested On-Mountain Meetups:

• Friday, 1:00 pm at the Condo for lunch

• Friday 7:30pm HOT TUB!


• Saturday, 12:00 pm at the Condo for lunch

• Friday & Saturday, 4:30pm at the Condo for après ski/snowboard


• Sunday, 11:30 am at Sky Haus Canteen (top of the Tram) for lunch (if tram is not spinning, meet at Tower Bar at base)

• Sunday, 3:00 pm at The Drink (in Pump House) for après ski/snowboard, before heading home.
results.name: JAY PEAK 3 day weekend (with Luxury slope-side condos) and outdoor HOT TUB!

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:45AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

Join Building Energy Exchange for a panel of finance and development experts to discuss these and other critical issues surrounding the financing of Passive House projects of all types. The speaker panel showcases experts with deep project finance experience, presenting an opportunity to learn about their interactions with private lenders and the role of financial incentives in supporting these innovative projects. 

Topics to be addressed include: Is the financing of Passive House projects structured differently? Do underwriters account for deep reductions in operating costs in appraisals of asset value? results.description:
Imagine taking a leap of faith from a high profile advertising career to fly helicopters over rainbows, travel to festivals, write about them and have it all pay out. Then do it again, with a group of girlfriends, which explodes into a mammoth online and offline hair movement now in its fifth year.

That’s the life of Tracey Coleman, a shiny example of what happens when you choose passion over process and create your own path. Tracey took Madison Avenue by storm working on such notable accounts as Michelle Obama’s national anti-obesity campaign “Let's Move” and several well-known beauty campaigns. Then, Tracey went on “vacation” and never came back.

She now runs multiple startup businesses, including the Brooklyn Travel Addict, nominated “Best Travel Blog” 2011, and Curly Girl Collective, a natural hair movement both online and off, as well as gets paid to contribute to several media publications including Travel Noire, Ebony, Parlour, Clutch Magazine and others.

Please join Tracey Coleman to hear the true secrets of living life to its fullest.
results.name: How to quit your day job and get paid to do what you love.

If you are a writer, consultant, designer, or programmer -- This is ideal for you!

This is not a typical meetup. This meetup is to offer you a FREE morning to work out of The CoWorking Space and understand what coworking is all about.

We have coffee, water, snacks, free parking in the back lot (unlimited hours) and on Main Street (for only 3 hours).

We have great food right around the corner, banks, ATMs, convenience stores and more all within your reach. So get out of your house, stop working alone and come by for a FREE day!

Besides bringing your laptop, bring business cards as you will meet others to network with in between work.

See you on our next Fun Friday!

Noelle

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Jonathan Drillings  come and share his journey. (Special thanks to Katie Frankel at FFVC for the intro)

Jonathan is a Principal with Comcast Ventures and invests across the technology spectrum, although has a particular focus on platforms that leverage data and modern communication channels to drive automation, personalization and intelligence. He works with companies during the investment process and throughout the investment lifespan, leveraging his background to assist portfolio companies as they grow and develop.

Prior to Comcast Ventures, Jonathan's background spanned various investment and operating roles. After graduating with a degree in engineering, and starting his career in investment banking, he spent several years with Investor Growth Capital (IGC), a growth-stage venture capital firm. After IGC, he joined BrightWire, a venture-backed start-up where he held various roles, most recently as the head of product development. After BrightWire, Jonathan was Director, Operations at Yext before joining Comcast Ventures.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

results.description:
"We're Getting Better" is a podcast that focuses on photographic situations, experiences and lessons, all aimed to grow a community of aspiring photographers. Tune in each week for a new recording and let's get better together. For new episodes, please visit https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/were-getting-better/id1002411744

Bryon Summers is the resident photographer for the number one hip-hop podcast, The Combat Jack Show and host of his own weekly photography based podcast, We're Getting Better. In 2013, Summers moved to New York to work for an ambitious media company. While there he wore several hats serving as an Associate Producer, Director of Photography, and Creative Services Producer he helped create daily content as well as over 10 documentaries. Outside of the 9-5 grind, Summers shot personal photography projects that eventually lead to exhibitions in New York and New Jersey.

Summers took the stage at a CreativeMornings New York event and was bitten by the speaking bug. Since then he has used his experiences in and out of media as topics to share with audiences of aspiring to progress in their respective fields. In addition to creating We’re Getting Better, Summers has held educational workshops at universities and venues.

Bryon is a Maryland native

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/Bryon%20Summers%20BIO_small.JPG?itok=4QBdxnPd

Bryon Summers is the resident photographer for the hip-hop podcast “The Combat Jack Show” and host of his own weekly photography podcast “We're Getting Better.” 

In 2013, Summers moved to New York to work as Associate Producer, Director of Photography, and Creative Services Producer for a media company. He helped create daily content as well as over ten feature length documentaries. Summers has also had works displayed in exhibitions in New York and New Jersey.

Find more work at BryonSummers.com and on Instagram @BryonSummers.
results.name: We're getting better w/ Bryon Summers

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
COLLIDING DREAMS, opens Lincoln Plaza Cinema, March 4 with filmmakers' Q&A's during opening weekend. 

Few can mention the word Zionism without a strong response. This film's historical analysis offers audiences the opportunity for informed discussion.   

Colliding Dreams is an exploration of the dream of a Jewish state and its impact on both Jews and Arabs. Few ideas in the modern era have had as momentous an impact on the world as Zionism. Born in the late 19th century, this seemingly utopian dream was meant to solve the age-old problem of anti-Semitism and to allow a place for Jewish life and culture to thrive. Few could have envisioned its rapid success: the creation in less than a century of a thriving democratic Jewish state.  

COLLIDING DREAMS takes a look at how the idea behind the Jewish State has evolved. Its resonance comes from allowing all sides to talk freely. Told through the lives and voices of Jews and Palestinians living in the Middle East today, COLLIDING DREAMS weaves together past and present of Jews and Palestinians to develop a film portrait of depth and sensitivity. 

And yet despite its success, the very legitimacy of the Zionist Idea is questioned more today than before. The debate over Israel -- triggered by the latest war or terrorist attack or national election – is often guided by emotion rather than substance rather than a thorough understanding of Zionism and its history. 

 From award winning filmmakers Joseph Dorman (Sholem Aleichem: Laughing in the Darkness and Arguing the World) and Oren Rudavsky (A Life Apart: Hasidism in America and Hiding and Seeking)

 “Fabulous. A must-see documentary." - Jewniverse 

“Admirably Balanced and Comprehensive. Thoughtful and Invaluable. Stands as a significant cinematic achievement.” – Frank Scheck, The Hollywood Reporter 

For questions & group discounts: lisa.smithline <at> gmail.com

http://collidingdreamsthemovie.com

https://www.facebook.com/DreamsColliding

https://twitter.com/DreamsColliding

http://www.lincolnplazacinema.com/coming-soon/colliding-dreams.aspx

https://youtu.be/7UChvMGkjEg

results.description:
Not sure about your sea legs?  NO PASSPORT??  THIS is the cruise for you!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqDyI-w3PIk

4 Day/3 Night Cruise on Royal Caribbean's newest, largest, most awe-inspiring ship!

PRICE:  Starting at $995pp Single OR Double Occupancy!! - $250 Deposit 

CLICK HERE for online payment

Drive/carpool to New Jersey and experience this epitome of luxury at sea -- and do it in only an extended weekend! :-) 

Anthem of the Seas Overview 

Anthem of the Seas, the second of three 167,800-ton, 4,180-passenger next-generation Royal Caribbean cruise ships, will launch April 2015 in Southampton, England, with 2,090 cabins including 375 virtual balconies -- inside cabins featuring real-time views of the ocean and destinations visited. 

Like Quantum of the Seas, Anthem of the Seas will feature many first-at-sea innovations including:

• RipCord by iFly, a skydiving simulator; 

• North Star, a jewel-shaped glass capsule that rises 300 feet above sea level, providing 360-degree views from high above the ship; and

• SeaPlex, the largest indoor sports and entertainment comoplex at sea with attractions ranging from bumper cars, roller skating and video gaming to a circus school complete with flying trapeze classes.

Several new cabin categories like: virtual balconies that dispel the traditional idea of an inside cabin, family-connected staterooms that prove more accommodating for large groups and studio staterooms with balconies that spoil the single traveler.

Don't wait!!!  Deposit for a spin on this AMAZING feat of modern shipbuilding TODAY.

REFUNDS - (minus $100, only with replacement traveler and only up to 90 days before travel)

TRIP COST:  $995PP

https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlp1/v/t1.0-9/12391794_534138196749779_307426941070518079_n.jpg?oh=2fdeb4690b11c9c7e46d286b5d9396ac&oe=5715380E

https://www.facebook.com/metrographNYC ;

Surrender to the Screen: Watching the Moviegoing Experience (March 4-10)
Titles include: "The Long Day Closes" (Terence Davies, 1992), "Vivre sa Vie" (Jean-Luc Godard, 1962), "Goodbye, Dragon Inn" (Tsai Ming-liang, 2003), "Taxi Driver" (Martin Scorsese, 1976), "Matinee" (Joe Dante, 1993), "Desperately Seeking Susan" (Susan Seidelman, 1985), "Variety" (Bette Gordon, 1983), "Demons (Lamberto Bava, 1985) and more. 

Jean Eustache (March 9-17)
Extended engagements of Eustache's two features "The Mother and the Whore" (1973) and "Mes Petites Amoureuses" (1974), along with "Les Mauvaises Fréquentations" (1963), "Santa Claus Has Blue Eyes" (1967) and more rare imported prints. Presented with support from the Cultural Services of the French Embassy and Institut Français. Special thanks to Amélie Garin Davet, Mathieu Fournet, and Françoise Lebrun

"The Student Nurses" (One Week Revival: March 11-17)The sole female filmmaker in a renowned boys’ club, Stephanie Rothman made a small, but significant series of subversive exploitation films. One of her greatest films is the ensemble drama "The Student Nurses," which forgoes cheap psychologizing and sexual gratuity for a nuanced take on the professional and personal options faced by women. Metrograph will present a new 35mm print from Academy Film Archives, with support from the Women's Film Preservation Fund and Cinema Conservancy.

Welcome to Metrograph: A-F (March 16 - April 21)Titles include: "The Age of Innocence" (Martin Scorsese, 1993), "Barry Lyndon" (Stanley Kubrick, 1975), "The Blood of a Poet" (Jean Cocteau, 1932), "Chelsea Girls" (Andy Warhol, 1966, image above), "The Clock" (Vincente Minnelli, 1945), "Comrades: Almost A Love Story" (Peter Chan, 1996), "Deux fois" (Jackie Raynal, 1968), "The Devil Probably" (Robert Bresson, 1977), "Dr. Jekyll and Mr Hyde" (Rouben Mamoulian, 1931), "Equinox Flower" (Yasujiro Ozu, 1958), and more. All films on 35mm or 16mm.

"A Space Program" (One Week Engagement: March 18-24)World-renowned contemporary artist Tom Sachs transformed New York’s Park Avenue Armory into a space station, immersing visitors into a large-scale installation, titled "Space Program 2.0. Mars." In this new documentary, co-directors Sachs and Van Neistat give viewers intimate glimpses into the production of this beautiful and playful world, following the crew as they embark on a risky mission to the red planet. "A Space Program" is a vivid work of art on its own terms.

Old and Improved (Sundays Beginning March 20)Every Sunday starting March 20, we’re pleased to present a new preservation or restoration. In some cases, these screenings mark the first times these prints have shown to the public. Titles include Dorothy Arzner’s "Craig's Wife" (1936), Garson Kanin’s "My Favorite Wife" (1940), Josef von Sternberg's "Crime and Punishment (1935), Apichatpong Weerasethakul’s "Mysterious Object at Noon" (2000), Djibril Diop Mambéty's "Touki Bouki" (1973), and Joyce Chopra's "Joyce at 34" (1972) plus shorts from New York's Youth Film Distribution Center. All titles on 35mm or 16mm

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at pret a manger to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 7 students per group and costs $10/person if there are more than 3 people or $15/person if they are 1-3 people.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation beginner. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate
results.name: Meet and play in Jersey City ( in German language )

results.description:
For our first event featuring one of my bands, I've chosen my piano trio featuring two of my favorite musicians, pianist Art Hirahara (on keyboard) and bassist Noriko Ueda at a beautiful new venue, The Broadway Lounge on the eighth floor of the Marriott Marquis in Times Square. It's a plush room, with good acoustics, stunning views of Times Square, great food (the best of the four Marriotts I've played), and a really comfortable area near the band for eating/hanging/listening/talking and getting to meet one other. You can see a picture here, along with the menu: http://www.marriott.com/hotel-restaurants/nycmq-new-york-marriott-marquis/broadway-lounge/5272396/home-page.mi. (The seating area I'm describing is just out of view, on the far left; raised, and in the foreground on the left is where my band plays.) There is no cover charge.

Because of the timing, I won't be scheduling a formal meal before the event, but will assume that many of you might like to eat during the event. I'll look forward to joining you during our breaks, during one of which I'll be eating dinner myself.

If you'd like to learn more about the group, Art's website is here: <a>http://arthirahara.com</a>;, Noriko's is here: <a>http://www.norikoueda.com</a>;, and the portion of my website that describes my piano trio is here: http://www.chuckbraman.com/piano-trio.html.

By the way, 5-9:00 is the time we'll be performing. No worries if anyone is late!
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the 8th Floor, make two right turns after exiting the elevator, walk towards Broadway to The Broadway Lounge. Our group will be on the raised seating area nearest the band.
results.name: Chuck Braman Trio featuring Art Hirahara & Noriko Ueda at the Broadway Lounge

results.description:
A one-hour tasting introduction to state-changing botanical elixirs sourced from the best ingredients around the world.

$20 tickets on line
$25 tickets at the door

Purchase Tickets Here: https://hourofhappiness.splashthat.com/

Doors open at 5pm. *Make sure to allot one hour to do the full flight*

We like to think of ourselves as disrupting the social drinking scene.

Be the first to explore a new generation of state-changing imbibables that don’t rely on alcohol to change your state: relaxing your body, heightening your senses, opening your heart, and energizing your being. Discover plants that were once a Soviet military secret, reverse your graying hair, and make bears (or you) lick each other for hours. We combine scientific crafting with indigenous wisdom traditions to bring you a new world of extraordinary whole plant elixirs and tonics that change your state, benefit your body and enrich your being. WHY PLANTS?

Inspired by indigenous shamanic practices, our shared connection with the planet we inhabit, and the common threads between global wisdom traditions, we believe in the "alchemical" power of plants to help us move into greater awareness and bring conscious intention to our lives.
results.name: Hour of Happiness: A Different Kind of Happy Hour with Botanical Elixirs

results.description:
Moroccan Court Music Series: Amir Vahab and Ensemble Amir Vahab and his ensemble will perform Sufi Songs of Love, selected from the poetry of the great Sufi masters Rumi, Hafez, Yunus, and Baba Taher. The ensemble's lively folk and traditional music will feature the ethereal-sounding ney (mystical reed flute), tar (instrument of lovers), oud (short-neck lute), tanbour (ancient sacred lute), saz (seven-stringed long-neck lute), daf (large-frame drum associated with Sufi rituals), and tombak (Persian goblet drum). The concert will conclude with a dynamic drumming performance that echoes the universal heartbeat of existence.

http://www.metmuseum.org/events/programs/met-live-arts/moroccan-court-music-series?eid=A004_%7b260730F0-92A0-4B2E-BB91-DBF913164F42%7d_20160216132257&program=MetLiveArts&location=main%7cbreuer%7ccloisters&startDate=3%2f1%2f2016+12%3a06%3a02+AM&page=1

LETS MEET IN GALLERY 456/2nd fl (between 5:45 -7:10pm)

http://www.metmuseum.org/-/media/Files/Visit/Met%20Fifth%20Avenue%20Map.pdf

PLEASE NOTE:
-Performance starts at 6pm. Please feel free to join at any time.
-After the performance lets explore the museum. Please let me know what exhibitions and galleries you would be interested in exploring. Let's make this decision as a group.

For your listening pleasure
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rz2zDSdBTfQ

Asia talk interview with Amir Vahab
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F1wSZBs0fT0&ebc=ANyPxKr-kNXHiwnnU9uzBtFu6fvR3eepoU5oAyLQkkP0adeK2Ux_Ua8zZka6bMSNejTGjZQZXYZd-EpqgfzzadcsANK53JzR0A

The enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

See you there!

Andy

results.description:
Let's Get Social and Have FUN = True BLISS!!

We're mixing it up and hanging out at the very cool, Cafe' Serai in the Rubin Museum of Art. The energy of the Bliss seekers who show up fully, mixed with the energy of the Rubin are worth the visit. So inspiring!!!  Great way to turn around a stressful week,  celebrate a joyful one and make new friends!

COME FOR PART OR ALL OF THE EVENING!

This is one of my VERY FAVORITE places to gather in NYC.
If you have never been you will love it:
* The food is yummy-eclectic
* Happy hour = 2:1 house drinks, 6:00 - 7:00 pm
* There's a DJ (music, not dance)
* Museum is FREE on Fridays (tour @ 7pm) with an awesome collection of Himalayan and Nepalese art, and spirit-inspiring spaces (like the Tibetan Shrine room exhibit.


Check out the website to learn more about the activities: http://www.rubinmuseum.org
NOTE: Fridays are busy, so come early and get your food & drinks.

NATURAL NETWORKING: It is well known that people hire you because they "know, like and trust" you.  In this atmosphere, it is easy to relax, be yourself and authentically attractive.  This is about personal connection!  Try to avoid the dreaded & boring "what do you do?" question.  How about, "What's your passion?" to get a real conversation started, and find out how/if you and the other person resonate.


Come to have FUN, but bring your business cards in case someone wants to connect with you or learn more about you and what you bring to the world by way of your business.  Many profitable connections have already grown from these events, e.g., new clients, great resources, support networking and much more.

It's great to mix business with retreat & mindfulness. Playtime is key to creativity and productivity.  It's also a great way to nurture natural networking & nurture creative soul.

I look forward to meeting you for the first time, reconnecting and enjoying food, fun and drinks (alcoholic or non)

From my heart to yours,
results.name: [Social Bliss] Fun & Fabulous Evening Mixer (Natural Networking) FREE

group.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

----

Optional Warmup games/exercises will be from 5:45pm-6pm, prior to the start of the jam.  

Also promoted on fb: https://www.facebook.com/events/894397014008294/
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
Join us on Friday March 4th for an evening of connections and culture over cocktails at NYC's largest Afro-Caribbean mixer & to celebrate women's hisory month & the indepndence of 5 African Countries. Theme - Renaissance African Woman

March is "Women's History Month" and March 8th is "International Women's Day". We will be celebrating the contributions and achievements of African Women In The Diaspora including a 5-10 minute spotlight on African Women Founders of great business and/or causes.

Come Early To Network | Stay Late To Party

You must RSVP by EOD on Thursday March 3rd to be added to the guestlist

Free Before 7pm with RSVP | $10 After 7pm | $20 after 8pm Note: You must be checked in by 7pm for free admission. There is usually a line at the door so plan to be there latest by 6:30pm in order to be checked in by 7pm

An evening of connections & culture over cocktails

Click on the video and photo links below for a taste of Afropolitan experience Click on the video and photo links below for the taste of Afropolitan experience in various cities

Video:
https://vimeo.com/146887367 - DC
https://vimeo.com/147191726 - NYC
https://vimeo.com/149983329 - Miami
https://vimeo.com/149181648 - Houston
https://vimeo.com/136120115 - Baltimore
Last event allbum: http://tinyurl.com/AFPPH1215 DJs: DJ Spynfo | DJ Freshk
Music: Afrobeats | Dancehall Reggae | Soca | Hiphop | Pop | Latin

Dress Code(Strictly Enforced) Ankara Wear, Professional, Classy. No T-Shirts, Hats, or Tennis shoes.

Age Limit(21): Mature clientele only Come early for great happy hour drink specials:(6pm – 7:30pm):
House Wines: $7.00
Domestic & Heineken Beer: $7.00
Belvedere Vodka cocktails: $8.00 VIP | Birthdays | Private Celebrations
Take advantage of our incredible VIP packages. Celebrate birthdays and other special occasions in private with special ones


Closest Metro Stations
50th Street [C,E] - 3 Blocks Away
49 St[N,Q,R] - 2 & Half Blocks Away ********************************************************
Join our facebook group @
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1653600624895675/ ********************************************************
Sponsorship and Marketing Opportunities
Contact [masked] for sponsorship & business spotlight opportunities.
or call[masked]

Powered by: Drumpulse Entertainment
Stay connected: @AfropolitanNYC | #AfropolitanNYC

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project.

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details.

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Friday March 04,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
One of my favorite things is picnics. It's too cold for a picnic, so the next best thing is an indoor potluck. And, as if great food weren't enough, to sweeten the deal we'll also have a variety of games on hand to enjoy as well. 


Please bring a vegan food item to share (no meat, chicken, fish, eggs, dairy, or honey). While it isn't required, gluten-free items (i.e. things that don't contain wheat, barley, soy sauce, and couscous) would be greatly appreciated as I cannot eat gluten. Dishes containing gluten are fine--just make sure to label them as such. The same with things containing nuts, as some members have nut allergies. 

Games on hand include Ticket to Ride: Marklin (a train-themed boardgame for 2 to 6 players), Hanabi (a cooperative card game from Japan for 2 to 5 players), Scrabble, Monopoly Junior (hey, I have nieces and nephews), and regular playing cards. Feel free to bring something else or teach us how to play a new card game. 

Ticket to Ride is a little complicated, so you may want to familiarize yourself with the basics here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1911_-JBh00

The video is super long, just skip the Europe part and get to the Marklin part. This shorter video on the original American version is helpful as well: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qPgxVkGgm8

Scott is a super nerd, so please don't let his presentation turn you off from this game! 

My apartment is in Washington Heights. Closest subway is the A to 181st Street. The 1 to 181st is also close, though is about four blocks away. Neither stations are very handicap friendly--there is an escalator at the A station, but you still need to take stairs to and from the escalator. The same with the elevator at the 1 station. My building has an elevator and a ramp can be put downstairs if needed. 

Allergy alert: I have a 12-year-old cat and two six-month-old kittens. 

I hope to see some familiar as well as some new faces!
