results.description:
The Schomburg Center hosts a social networking event the first Friday evening of each month, rain or shine, from 6 pm to 10pm.


This month, The Schomburg Center is proud to present a special "70s” edition of First Fridays, their popular monthly social gathering! Commemorating the funkadelic era of the 70s, this event will pay tribute to the sounds, vibes, and fashion of the decade. 

Mix and mingle in the Langston Hughes Lobby as you enjoy our signature drinks while grooving to beats by DJ Sylk, with your host of the evening Dhalimu from Dhali’s Closet.

Suggested dress code give is 70s glam!

Suggested donations are welcome and sign up for a Schomburg membership is always encouraged.


Our Meetup


We'll meet in the Langston Hughes lobby where the music will be playing. There will be a drink table with a HarlemGo Meetup sign to gather there.

Please find me (Daniel) at the HarlemGo drink table. I, as well as others, will be wearing a "GO" name tag (similar to the image above) on the front of my jacket/shirt, and name tags will be given out to identify other members. 

Many of the library and NYPL staff and executives attend the Schomburg Center's First Fridays events, as well as a wide variety of professionals from many backgrounds and industries. Definitely a good social & networking opportunity!

Post-First Fridays Drinks at Ginny's Supper Club

Afterwards, we'll head down to Ginny's Supper Club at Red Rooster
(www.ginnyssupperclub.com) to keep the good spirits going with a nightcap of drinks at the bar, socializing and dancing. Making a dinner reservation at Ginny's is strongly suggested for those that may want to grab a bite after the Schomburg event.

We'll arrive at Ginny's around 9:30pm and will end the meetup there officially at 11pm. If you can't make the Schomburg event, feel free to meetup with us there, and anyone is welcome to stay as long as they'd like.

Ginny's Supper Club is located on the downstairs level of Red Rooster
(www.redroosterharlem.com), 310 Lenox Avenue, between 125th & 126th Streets. 

As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of people of African descent.
results.name: First Fridays @ The Schomburg Center ('70's Edition) & Ginny's After

results.description:
FRIDAY-March 4th 2016 will be our next meet up. 

*** HAPPY HOUR FROM 6-7PM. 

The event will be held upstairs in the Skylight room.

 Click on the link below to purchase your ticket now and reserve your spot.

https://njnetworkingmixer.eventbrite.com 

"NETWORKING is the single most powerful marketing tactic to accelerate and sustain success for any individual or organization!" – Adam Small 

Why do I need to network?

1. As entrepreneurs and professionals, it is imperative that we stay around like minded individuals. Relationships are the catalyst for success. 

2. In this ever so growing competitive job market, you will quickly learn that it is not always what you know, but who do you know.

3. You never know what personal connection or business deal is hidden in a little conversation. 

4. If you are seasoned, you can meet a young pup with a lot of pep to do heavy lifting for you.

5. If you are new, you can meet an expert in your field and skip a lot of mistakes just by listening to their experiences. 

There are many advantages to networking. Here at the NJ Networking Circle we like to keep things fun and innovative. What better way is there to wind down a hard work week then with a little professional party and networking. We like to consider ourselves the transition group because we are not in an up tight work atmosphere, nor is it a full blown out night at the club. You can consider it to be either the cool down of a long week or the warm up to a great weekend; the choice is yours. We just want you to take a load off and have a great time meeting great people. 

Please RSVP the event and post comments or suggestions.
results.name: NJ Networking Mixer

results.description:
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

Come on out  to our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle. We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle is the perfect place for you!

Everyone gets a card with an image on it. Your goal is to find people in the room with the match to your card. For example, if you have a card with a picture of a jar of peanut butter on it, you'll be looking for someone with a card with a picture of jelly on it. The more of your matches you find, the more raffle tickets you'll get with chances to win prizes!

This icebreaker isn't overly structured. You can relax, have drinks and mingle at your own pace... participating as much or as little as you'd like.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Friday, March 4th, 6:30 PM - 10:30 PM (If coming in from a distance, it's perfectly fine if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St., NYC)

results.description:
The Arts Collective is going to the Circus! Join the New Rochelle Arts Collective FRIDAY, March 4th for an evening of figure drawing and fun, hosted at MADE's Art Studio: 

https://www.facebook.com/madeartstudio


This month were featuring a contortionist model for our circus theme. So come one, come all! We'll provide the model, music and drinks, you guys provide the good vibes and your creativity.


As always: 

Bring your own art materials 

Drinks are avaiable while supplies last

Outside beverages are welcomed

No photography

Addmission:

$15 at the door

$12 for students w/ valid college ID

18+ to enter; 21+ to drink


This month's poster was illustrated by Rayna Sassano (@purplelantern) and designed by David Gonzalez (@pencildrifter)

venue.name: The Campbell Terrace at Grand Central

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

Grand Central Terminal is one of NYC's most iconic landmarks.  It is filled with history, cool hidden secrets and 4 awesome bars!! Join us for this fun night of socializing, learning exploring and cocktails. 

The group will meet at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar for socializing then set out for a journey through the past present and future! A small portion of the tour will take place outside so bundle up! During the course of the evening we will visit The Campbell Apartment, Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and The Saloon Bar at The Oyster Bar.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door) 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grand-central-an-educational-bar-crawl-inside-the-iconic-new-york-landmark-tickets-22467839914

</a>

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP!

What to expect:

-Space is limited to 20 people

-We will be at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar from 6:30-7pm.

-At 7pm we will start our tour.  During the tour we will stop at at least 2 other bars at Grand Central.

-You will learn the history of the building including the 2 other train stations that were on that site from 1871-1901. You will be blown away by amazing photographs that will make you appreciate the rich history that makes this building so special.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

Do I have to drink? No, but it would help if you ordered a soft drink.  We just can't have 20 people ordering water.  If you are not a drinker, consider taking our regular Grand Central History Tour which we offer several times per month!

What is Included? $15 includes the tour only.  Drinks are extra.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door) 

<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grand-central-an-educational-bar-crawl-inside-the-iconic-new-york-landmark-tickets-22467839914">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grand-central-an-educational-bar-crawl-inside-the-iconic-new-york-landmark-tickets-22467839914

Is food available?  Each location has small plates that you can order from

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.
results.name: Grand Central: An Educational Bar Crawl Inside The Iconic New York Landmark

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间3月4日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program and the World Culture Festival.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. And we get to know about the World's biggest and most exciting Peace event on Mar 11-13th, called "World Culture Festival", in Delhi, India, this year.

When: Mondays 6:30pm-7:30pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbees

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)
results.name: Meditate, Rest & Recharge

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

We get it... You want to meet someone special but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of recent college grads or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!

Drink Specials!

Win Prizes!

Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending

* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: SPANISH CULTURE & CONVERSATION WORKSHOPS (BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATE)

results.description:
So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

We get it... You want to meet someone special but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of recent college grads or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!

Drink Specials!

Win Prizes!

Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending

* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's
results.name: 40's - 50's Singles Happy Hour- 10 TIX LEFT

results.description:
We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 & 30 somethings. That's why we've created this event filled with more mature singles (40s, 50s+)! And this time around we've added a free raffle & great prizes!

*GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/

*Prepay Only Event. Tickets Not Sold At Door. 

What to expect:   

• Free Light Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials (6:30-7:30pm)

• 100+ singles in their 40s, 50s+  

• Ice Breakers, Raffle & Prizes 

• Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

*MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE ($20) - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/

*Price goes up to $30 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. 

• As date gets closer, we may shut down tix for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced.  Get tix ASAP to secure your spot, especially women. 

• Typically 75% of attendees come alone (25% bring friends) 

• Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts) 

• MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. 100+ SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

PREPAY ONLY - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/40sover/

results.description:
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

Come on out  to our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle. We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle is the perfect place for you!

Everyone gets a card with an image on it. Your goal is to find people in the room with the match to your card. For example, if you have a card with a picture of a jar of peanut butter on it, you'll be looking for someone with a card with a picture of jelly on it. The more of your matches you find, the more raffle tickets you'll get with chances to win prizes!

This icebreaker isn't overly structured. You can relax, have drinks and mingle at your own pace... participating as much or as little as you'd like.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

WHEN: Friday, March 4th, 6:30 PM - 10:30 PM (If coming in from a distance, it's perfectly fine if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: Pranna Lounge (79 Madison Avenue, at 28th St., NYC)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Great Drink Specials From 6:30 to 7:30!
* Light Passed Appetizers From 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM
* Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Stylish (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

group.name: New York Business Opportunity Seekers and Providers

results.description: “First Friday” is a casual evening for drinks and socializing.  Pranna Restaurant has high and open ceilings with a trendy atmosphere including a beautiful light colored décor and box shaped tables.  Food is inspired by Southern Asia (including Thai, Vietnam, India) - appetizer / finger food or full dinner.  Pranna has some signature drinks, standard bar, nice variety of wine by the glass and variety beer (draft and bottled).  Come join the party and meet current and prospective members.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the bar area and ask the host desk.  I will try to arrive early and get a table near the entrance (near the front windows).
results.name: First Friday at Pranna Restaurant

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

venue.name: The Campbell Terrace at Grand Central

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].


Grand Central Terminal is one of NYC's most iconic landmarks.  It is filled with history, cool hidden secrets and 4 awesome bars!! Join us for this fun night of socializing, learning exploring and cocktails. 

The group will meet at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar for socializing then set out for a journey through the past present and future! A small portion of the tour will take place outside so bundle up! During the course of the evening we will visit The Campbell Apartment, Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and The Saloon Bar at The Oyster Bar.


</a>

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP!

What to expect:

-Space is limited to 20 people

-We will be at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar from 6:30-7pm.

-At 7pm we will start our tour.  During the tour we will stop at at least 2 other bars at Grand Central.

-You will learn the history of the building including the 2 other train stations that were on that site from 1871-1901. You will be blown away by amazing photographs that will make you appreciate the rich history that makes this building so special.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

Do I have to drink? No, but it would help if you ordered a soft drink.  We just can't have 20 people ordering water.  If you are not a drinker, consider taking our regular Grand Central History Tour which we offer several times per month!

What is Included? $15 includes the tour only.  Drinks are extra.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)


<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grand-central-an-educational-bar-crawl-inside-the-iconic-new-york-landmark-tickets-22467839914">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/grand-central-an-educational-bar-crawl-inside-the-iconic-new-york-landmark-tickets-22467839914

Is food available?  Each location has small plates that you can order from


If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

Hi Guys,

Thanks for signing up for the Grand Central Tour tonight!  I will meet the group at the top of the steps for the entrance for the Campbell Apartment Bar.  It is actually a temporary bar set up outside of The Campbell Apartment where the elevators are. It is located on the west side of Grand Central on the Vanderbilt Avenue side.   The entrance is from the outside.  I will have an NYSN sign.  If you get lost please call me at[masked]-1098.  Please try to get there at 6:30 sharp as I have a reservation with the bar.

Please bring exact change $15 if possible.  We have many people registered from several groups including www.newyorksocialnetwork.com and this will help speed up the sign in process.

Thanks

Dave
results.name: Grand Central: An Educational Bar Crawl Inside The Iconic New York Landmark

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org
results.name: Breath To Happiness

results.description:
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html


Come on out  to our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle. We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars among a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Big Raffle Mingle is the perfect place for you!

Everyone gets a card with an image on it. Your goal is to find people in the room with the match to your card. For example, if you have a card with a picture of a jar of peanut butter on it, you'll be looking for someone with a card with a picture of jelly on it. The more of your matches you find, the more raffle tickets you'll get with chances to win prizes!

This icebreaker isn't overly structured. You can relax, have drinks and mingle at your own pace... participating as much or as little as you'd like.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Stargazing

DIRECTION:

We plan to meet at Broadway & 116th Street and then walk to the Pupin Physics Laboratories as a group. Please do not be late and read my comment below.

DESCRIPTION:

Please join us for a free public stargazing event at Pupin Physics Laboratory of Columbia University. The event will begin with a lecture accompanied by guided star-gazing, slideshows, and Q&A with real astronomers. Lecture will last approximately 30 minutes and if the weather permits, it will be followed by 90 minutes of rooftop star-gazing through many of their telescopes. They also offer astrophotography slideshows (small, informal lectures) and Q&A with astronomers during the event so that people can cycle between the various stations (or get a respite from the cold on the roof).

ATTRACTIONS:

• Powerful Telescope

https://sp.yimg.com/ib/th?id=JN.YTGV8cXwxZsjb%2b3oJxbaDA&pid=15.1&P=0

• Planets in our solar system

• Stars

• Nebulas

• If your very lucky, then UFO's

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

Grand Central Terminal is one of NYC's most iconic landmarks.  It is filled with history, cool hidden secrets and 4 awesome bars!! Join us for this fun night of socializing, learning exploring and cocktails. 

The group will meet at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar for socializing then set out for a journey through the past present and future! A small portion of the tour will take place outside so bundle up! During the course of the evening we will visit The Campbell Apartment, Michael Jordan's Steakhouse and The Saloon Bar at The Oyster Bar.

What to expect:

-space is limited to 20 people

-We will be at The Campbell Apartment Balcony Bar from 6:30-7pm.

-At 7pm we will start our tour.  During the tour we will stop at at least 2 other bars at Grand Central.

-You will learn the history of the building including the 2 other train stations that were on that site from 1871-1901. You will be blown away by amazing photographs that will make you appreciate the rich history that makes this building so special.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

Do I have to drink? No, but it would help if you ordered a soft drink.  We just can't have 20 people ordering water.  If you are not a drinker, consider taking our regular Grand Central History Tour which we offer several times per month!

What is Included? $15 includes the our only.  Drinks are extra.

Is food available?  Each location has small plates that you can order from

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.
results.name: Grand Central: An Educational Bar Crawl Inside The Iconic New York Landmark

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Dear Friends,

New York Italians in collaboration with Fordham University, Department of Modern Languages and Literature and
Italian Honor Society C.I.A.O. is very happy to invite you to:

Presentation and discussion of the film: Presentation and discussion of the film:

La Sapienza director Eugene Greene


Fordham University, Lincoln Center Campus
113 W 60th street, NY, NY
Room SL24L  March 4th 2016 at 6:45 PM


English Subtitles


Admission is free but space is limited.

PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO NEW YORK ITALIANS MEMBERS (membership card required: http://www.newyorkitalians.org/become-member/)

RSVP mandatory at [masked]

At the height of his career, Alexandre decides to set off for Italy with the idea of completing his draft – interrupted years earlier – of a book on Borromini. He is accompanied by his wife Alienor who feels her relationship with her husband gradually slipping away along with the passion it used to inspire. Having reached Stresa they happen to meet Goffredo and Lavinia, a pair of siblings who live there: the former is about to embark in architectural studies, the second is suffering from a nervous disorder. Reviving a maternal instinct that has lain dormant within her for so many years, Alienor feels the need to stay by Lavinia’s side to help her overcome her anxiety and suggests that her husband continue on his travels with Goffredo. This separation will be the start of an inner journey for both Alexandre and Alienor.
results.name: New York Italians Cinema at Fordham University Lincoln Center!!

results.description:
Pride is a joyous film with a serious message, and based on a true story, Pride was rated 92 on the rotten tomatoes tomatometer. Critics Consensus: Earnest without being didactic and uplifting without stooping to sentimentality, Pride is a joyous crowd-pleaser that genuinely works.

"PRIDE is inspired by an extraordinary true story. It's the summer of 1984, Margaret Thatcher is in power and the National Union of Mineworkers is on strike, prompting a London-based group of gay and lesbian activists to raise money to support the strikers' families. Initially rebuffed by the Union, the group identifies a tiny mining village in Wales and sets off to make their donation in person. As the strike drags on, the two groups discover that standing together makes for the strongest union of all. (C) CBS "

This film touches on the themes of income inequality by its focus on labor unions (one of the key factors promoting the economic strength of the middle class.) as well as the LGBTQ community. It also raises questions about the ability, willingness and success of various progressive groups working together.

Although the themes are serious, the film itself is fun and optimistic. Hope you will come and join us ! Snacks and beverages provided; contributions of the same welcome but not required.
results.name: Film and discussion - Pride (2014)

results.description:
Dir. Kent Jones. 2015, 82 mins. Digital projection. 

With Martin Scorsese, David Fincher, James Gray. The book Hitchcock/Truffaut, based on French director François Truffaut’s weeklong interview with Alfred Hitchcock, is a remarkably entertaining and incisive study of Hitchcock’s artistry and technique. Kent Jones’s film about the book is a tribute and a master class, with film clips, archival material, and interviews with directors whose work was profoundly influenced by Hitchcock. 

Tickets: $12 (Free for members at the Film Lover and MoMI Kids Premium levels and above).  Order tickets online. (Members may contact [masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.) 

Ticket purchase may be applied toward same-day admission to the Museum (see gallery hours). View the Museum’s ticketing policy here. For more information on membership and to join online, visit our membership page. 

If there is interest, we can go to a local eatery after the end of the film.  There is a Panera, an excellent (and inexpensive) Italian pizza and pasta place, and a very good Mexican restaurant nearby.

Be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.

Originally posted 2/22/16

results.description:
Admission: Suggested donation: $5, includes snacks and beverages

Directed by Spike Lee 

Director Spike Lee dives head-first into a maelstrom of racial and social ills, using as his springboard the hottest day of the year on one block in Brooklyn, NY. Three businesses dominate the block: a storefront radio station, where a smooth-talkin' deejay (Samuel L. Jackson) spins the platters that matter; a convenience store owned by a Korean couple; and Sal's Famous Pizzeria, the only white operated business in the neighborhood. .

Post-film discussion led by Chris Everett

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

Many seekers of spirit knowledge encounter resistance when pursuing spiritual development. Temptations, distractions and uneasy feelings often delay the development. Soul purification, the process to a transparent consciousness of Presence, is obtainable through regular soul exercises. It is said that when we pray, we talk to God and when we meditate, God talks to us. In this class we will examine reasons and remedies to assist one in spiritual advancement through a proven path to spirit. We will deepen the knowledge of both the ancient Aramaic Lord’s Prayer and the Tibetan Bon Dzogchen meditation. Audio samples and printed material will be distributed. Reference “Knowledge of the Higher Worlds and its Attainment” by Rudolf Steiner.

NOTE: Following a one hour presentation, the Edgar Cayce Healer’s Group practitioners will offer Bioenergy Healing to all who attend the evening and request it. Occasionally the length of the presentation portion may be adjusted to accommodate a guest speaker, or as karma dictates.

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
Public Talk and Weekend Retreat with Ven. Amy Miller 

Friday, March 4 from 7 to 9pm 

Saturday & Sunday, March 5-6 from 10am to 5pm 

at Tibet House

Register Now

"Every second of this human life is more precious than skies of wish-granting jewels." - Lama Zopa Rinpoche


Public Talk: Life as Practice

Friday, March 4 from 7 to 9pm 

If we only experience peace and insight on our meditation cushion or in retreat, the rest of our life may look even more frustrating and stressful than it already is. Imagine what it would be like to live each and every single moment of our life as an opportunity to develop calm, kindness, and insight. Each moment we have the choice. We can either add more confusion and frustration or we can grow a calm and peaceful mind and a warm and open heart. Why limit ourselves and not experience our full potential?

Ven. Amy Miller will teach us practical skills to incorporate Buddhist wisdom and compassion into daily life for greater happiness. 

Weekend Retreat: Touching Reality - Meditation, Mindfulness, and a Meaningful Life 

Saturday & Sunday, March 5-6 from 10am to 5pm 

When do less generous thoughts about ourselves take over our mind? When does everyday busyness lead to feeling overwhelmed and frustrated? Why do we have so much time for social media and technology, but not for meditation? In this weekend workshop, we will explore the habits that interfere with our peace of mind and inner contentment while learning effective techniques to incorporate wisdom and compassion into daily practice. Ven. Amy will delve into the richness of self-compassion, motivation, and meditation, building mindfulness throughout the day, and finding joy in putting it all together. The retreat will include teachings, short meditations, exercises, discussion, and Q&A. It is appropriate for those new to Buddhism as well as for experienced students wishing to deepen or rejuvenate an already existing practice. 

This weekend will give you a great taste of our upcoming Garrison Institute retreat with Ven. Amy. Don't miss these great opportunities to really work with your mind! 

Dates and Times: 

Friday, March 4

7-9pm   Public Talk 

Saturday & Sunday, March 5-6

10am-12:30pm     Morning Teachings with Tea Break

12:30pm-2pm       Lunch Break

2pm-5pm             Afternoon Teachings and Q&A with Tea Break

Suggested Donation: Weekend Retreat and Public Talk: $120, which includes light refreshments, lunch, and materials. 

Friday Public Talk only: $20

Weekend Retreat only: $100, which includes light refreshments, lunch, and materials. 

Shantideva Meditation Members: Public Talk: $18, Weekend Retreat: $90, Weekend Retreat and Public Talk: $108 Donations may be made online or at the door. 

Registration:

Please register in advance so we can prepare distributed material. To register, click here.

Online registration will close at 3pm on Friday, March 4. Walk-ins are welcome.

About the Teacher:

While taking a break from political organizing in Washington DC, Amy J. Miller (Ven. Lobsang Chodren) first encountered Tibetan Buddhism in the spring of 1987 during a course at Kopan Monastery in Nepal. Since then, she has spent a great deal of time engaged in meditation retreats, study, teaching, and Buddhist center management throughout the world. Ven. Amy has been teaching extensively since 1992 and was ordained as a Buddhist nun in June 2000 by the great Tibetan master, Ven. Choden Rinpoche. She has also directed several FPMT centers and projects for decades and has completed a seven-month solitary retreat. Click here for a full biography.  

Her teaching style emphasizes a practical approach to integrating Buddhist philosophy into everyday life. She is happy to help people connect with meditation and mindfulness in an effort to gain a refreshing perspective on normally stressful living. 

Based in the United States, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Amy teaches and leads retreats and pilgrimages around the world. Her teaching schedule and other information can be found at www.AmyMiller.com.

Live Blood Cell Analysis Lecture and Live Blood Analysis Session


Friday, February 19th, Live Blood Cell Analysis Lecture
Saturday, February 20th, Live Blood Cell Analysis 2 Hour Sessions with 

Marcy Pollan, M.A.
     

TAKE A TOUR OF YOUR "BioTERRAIN" with LIVE CELL IMAGING and FLOW ANALYSIS... Open a window into the dynamic world of your biological "terrain" or intracellular environment, to determine causes of metabolic imbalance before they result in overt symptoms and diseases. Combining direct visual observation at the cellular level with user-friendly tools to measure metabolic imbalance is an effective healthcare strategy that will empower you towards greater health freedom and autonomy. 

Learn and experience at the cellular level how your body's equilibrium can be disrupted by water and mineral depletion, toxins, yeast and fungus, bacteria, parasites, and other conditions resulting in inflammation, oxidative stress, and acidosis--and how these metabolic disruptors can be prevented or reversed before resulting in chronic diseases.

Marcy Pollan, MA, is a practitioner of Live Cell/Hemobiographic Imaging and Flow Analysis—a cutting-edge approach to self-managed healthcare that reveals dynamic life processes at the cellular level. A nutritional consultant for more than 15 years, her focus is on opening windows into intracellular dynamics––of blood cells, plasma, platelets, and electromagnetic (holographic) imprints in the blood––to reveal a real-time, more individualized, holistic map of the "bioterrain." 

Marcy has trained with visionaries in the field including Harvey Bigelsen, M.D., named Person of the Year by the Hans Neiper Institute for innovative work in homeopathy and blood holography; Biomedx, of Chicago, IL (engaged in some of the most ground-breaking life science research in the United States); and Dr. Marcus Shumway, ND, another pioneer in live cell and dry layer imaging. 

Marcy offers consulting services at The Center for Intentional Wellness and the Blissful Life Center, both in Winchester, VA, and has been a featured speaker and presenter at many progressive healthcare symposia in the Washington, DC metropolitan area.  Originally trained as a psychologist, her emphasis is on empowering clients with user-friendly tools and the education needed to maintain optimal wellness.


Marcy Pollan, M.A., is founder of Lightstream Analytics, and offers full Bioterrain/Live Blood Analysis for $225 on March 4th and March 5th

results.description:
Imagine a group of people, picking up a drum or some percussion; and next thing you know everyone is jamming! The air is filled with infectious sound and movement. You are floating and really feeling the beat! Sound is healing!

Drums and percussion available 
$15 at the door - add $5 if you need a drum

EarthMovers Drum Collective was formed so that everyone could have fun drumming at a circle and share in the rhythm and excitement of the collective drumming experience. 

Founder and facilitator Dave Miller started drumming with pots and pans, but his love for the art of drumming really grew in 1986 when he held a backyard garden blessing and friends came with drums and percussion. 

Dave has studied with Babatundi Olatunji, Greg “Sule” Wilson, Marie Tashian, Greg Hochman, Sheik Fall, Fred Goodnight, Jim Dav, Nadine Bergeron, Mark Wood and others. EarthMovers Drum Collective has performed at Kindred Spirits Fair, Saratoga Springs Jazz Festival, Synthetic Pleasure, Harvest Moon Fest, GoddessFest, on the beach, in parks and more.

Dave has enthusiastically performed and grooved at Starwood, Drums Around the World, New Rochelle Arts Festival, Fall Frolic, Drums from Heaven, The Head Start Program, Trenton Makes Words!, Rutgers University and with the PeaceWeavers, Spook Handy, Earth Vision Weavers, Triangle Drum Circle, Joachim Becker, Greg Metz, Sharon Silverstein, Hands of Change, Music For The Goddess, Mark Wood and others.

Dave has produced a variety of music programs and festivals for over 40 years and was a radio host for 7 years. He currently facilitates monthly drum circles and offers Pied Piper Parties drumming for children and adults, both privately and in schools and corporate settings. 

Contact: Dave Miller[masked]
[masked]
[masked]

results.description:
This event is the second of the "Reach-Out" for New Events initiative - to do more events like J-Dog's Climbing Day...

We'll be having this event in conjunction with Kat's wonderful "Northern New Jersey 20s-40s Friends" Group and Yitzchak's awesome "Bergen County Board Games" Group!...  Looking forward to meeting new people, seeing old friends and having a great time!...

Please RSVP Early, so I can let them know how many Nine-Ball Ninjas will be attacking them!

Please Note:  GPS generally leads everyone to the wrong location for this venue. The place is on Rt. 46 westbound right before the Main Street U-turn in Lodi. 

So let's see if we have any Nine-Ball Ninjas in the group!

Now I know, some of you might be thinking to yourself; but wait, I'm a billiard n00b. That's not a problem for three very important reasons:

• 1 - In Nine-Ball, it's all about the finish. The other player could get all eight of the balls in, but if you sink the Nine-Ball, you win. (... and you don't have to "call" pockets, "slop" counts.)

• 2 - I'm willing to show up at 7 PM and give a brief one-hour clinic on billiards. Ironically, the less experience the better (you've no bad habits... ;-)

• 3 - It's about having fun, and I'm hoping we'll have enough people for a few tables.

So please, RSVP quickly, so that I can let them know how many tables we need for our F&G Nine-Ball Ninjas!

Here's an outline of how the evening will progress:

• From 7-8 PM -- I'll give a quick class for those new to pool/billiards...

• From 8-9PM -- just open play / warm-up / practice...

• From 9 PM + ... we'll have a friendly "no stress" 9-Ball Ninja Tournament and/or open play for those who don't want to be a Ninja... 8-)


The kitchen is open until midnight, and the entrance is $10 per person flat rate! (no matter how long you stay...)  Pay at the door.

Also, if you want to just come and socialize; that's all good too!

Note: Please PM (and comment as well if you'd like) to let me know if you'll be showing up at 7PM for the clinic.

Thanks, and I look forward to releasing the inner Ninja in you all!!!

George
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the F&G Signs!  :-)

results.description:
A three day event, see full schedule below.

IMPORTANT NOTE for REGISTRATION

There is a ticket for each day of the conference.  We ask that you please only register for the day(s) that you intend to come.  While we fully intend to accommodate everyone who registers, registration does not guarantee you a seat. Space at all events will be first come first seated for all registered attendees. 


</a>

<a href="http://centerforjustice.columbia.edu/files/2016/01/BTB-poster.jpg">

To Register Visit: https://beyondthebars2016.eventbrite.com

Beyond the Bars 2016: Connecting the Struggles 

The 6th annual Beyond the Bars Conference will take place March 4-6, 2016 at Columbia University. This year’s conference, Connecting the Struggles, aims to connect the many ways in which mass incarceration has impacted individuals, families and communities across the U.S, and beyond, as well as build connections across diverse struggles for social justice.

Albert Einstein stated that imagination is more powerful than knowledge ––Our comrade and sister Angela Davis, challenged us to imagine a world without prison. Join us as we honor the spirit of the struggle – join in solidarity with impacted people, and with academics, activists, practitioners and community members as we continue to connect the struggles to eradicate mass incarceration and to build justice and equity.

As always, the conference is free and open to the public.

Conference Schedule

FRIDAY NIGHT KICK-OFF EVENT (Doors at 6:45 – Event Starts at 7:30)

Angela Davis
Virtual remarks from Mumia Abu-Jamal and Alicia Garza
Panel discussion with Cory Greene, Abraham Paulos, Delaine Powerful and Danielle Sered, moderated by Michelle Fine
Performances from Impact Repertory Theatre and the Theater for Social Change
Hosted by Malik Yoba

SATURDAY – CONNECTING THE STRUGGLES – MORNING PLENARIES AND AFTERNOON PANELS

Morning Plenaries (10 -1:15) 

The Roots of Mass incarceration and the History of Resistance to it (10 – 11:30)

Challenging Reform Efforts that Exclude People Convicted of Violent Offenses (11:45 – 1:15)

Lunch (1:15 – 2:15pm) 

Afternoon Panels (2:15 – 5:30pm) 

Block 1 (2:15-3:45pm) 

Deconstructing the Calls to End Mass Incarceration: Examining  Solutions, Strategies, Values, and Visions

Youth Activism: Mobilizing Communities for Social Change

Shaping Public Opinion: The Role of Journalism and Media in Defining Justice

Examining Surveillance and Technology in the Struggles for Justice

Mental Health: Across the Justice Continuum

Reducing the Number of People Incarcerated: Exploring Mechanisms and Strategies for Release

Ending State Violence Among Police and Corrections: Looking at Solutions

Equitable Access to Education Across the Carceral Continuum

Block 2

Electoral Politics and Legislative Reform: What’s Possible?

Solitary Confinement: An Area Where Efforts Have Made a Difference

Removing Barriers: Knowing, Enforcing, & Protecting Your Civil Rights After Justice System Involvement

Revisiting the 1996 Immigration Law: The Birth of Mass Deportations and Its Impact on Mass Incarceration

Responding to Violence Among Community Members:  Beyond Police and Incarceration

Arts and Activism: The impact That Cultural organizing Has on the Movement to End Mass Incarceration

The Power of the Student: Organizing for Justice on the College Campus

Women on the Rise: Emerging as Leaders for Criminal Justice Reform

Challenging the Punishment Paradigm: International and Domestic Models for Justice and Accountability

SUNDAY – BUILDING THE GRASSROOTS – ORGANIZING WORKSHOPS

Opening (11-11:30) 

Block 1 (11:30-1) 

How Social Workers are Connecting the Struggles

Methods Matter: Participatory Strategies for Planning, Action Research and Coalition Building

Mass Incarceration, Trauma, & Healing Strategies

The Mindful Activist

The Deal with Divestment: Organizing Prison Divestment in CUNY

We are All Prisoners

Abolishing THE BOX At The Neoliberal American University

Lunch (1-2)

Block 2 (2-3:30) 

Respecting Differences: Reducing Volatile Interactions between Youth and Law Enforcement on the Street

The Blueprint: Building Fortified Cities of Reentry

Change from the Inside Out: Rehabilitation Through the Arts,

From Correction Officer to Prison Advocate

The “Ex”: Simulating the Life of a Returning Citizen

Behind Enemy Lines: From Slavery to Mass Imprisonment

Connecting the Struggles, Challenging Incarceration

The Great Expulsion: ICE Raids/Criminalization of Immigrants in the US

Block 3 (3:45 – 5:15)

The Second Prison: Unlocking Second Chances

Formally Incarcerated Included

The Impact of the Prison Nation on Young Women and Girls

No Borders No Prisons: U.S. Immigration Jail and the Israeli Occupation of Palestine

Peacemaking Circles: Repairing Harm One Circle at a Time

Spread Mass LOVE: A Creative Approach to Healing Relationships and Repairing Harm Caused by Mass Incarceration

Reintegration Not Reentry

Multi-Racial Coalitions for Prison Divestment: Building Unity Against Mass Incarceration and Detention

Criminal Justice and Child Protection: Examining Intersections of Systemic Abuses

Beyond the Bars is organized by the Criminal Justice Caucus at the Columbia School of Social Work, the Center for Justice at Columbia University, and the Beyond The Bars Fellows.

Conference Co-Sponsors

The conference is organized with support from the Columbia University School of Social Work, the Heyman Center for the Humanities, the Justice-In-Education Initiative, the Institute for Research in African American Studies, the Prisoner Reentry Institute at John Jay College of Criminal Justice, Latin@ Caucus, the Policy Caucus and the Queer Caucus at Columbia School of Social Work.

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
"Most Likely to Succeed" is about re-imagining our outdated educational system for the 21st century, via a school that's doing it radically differently. 

We'll watch it together Friday night (free on site child-care!), and discuss afterwards. Plus, there will be snacks!

You can watch the trailer here.


Here's what the filmmakers have to say about their project:

"Most Likely To Succeed" (2015; Director Greg Whiteley) focuses on the topic of school — both its past and its future. The film inspires its audiences with a sense of purpose and possibility, and is bringing school communities together in re-imagining what our students and teachers are capable of doing.  After seeing this film, you’ll never look at school the same way again.


The current educational system in the United States was developed a century ago during the rise of the industrial age and was once the envy of the world. However, the world economy has since transformed profoundly, but the US education system has not. Schools are attempting to teach and test skills, when mastered, that still leave graduates woefully unprepared for the 21st Century. After presenting this problem, the documentary focuses on the story of a school in San Diego that is completely rethinking what the experience of going to school can look like. As we follow students, parents and teachers through a truly unorthodox school experience, the audience is inspired to consider what sort of educational environment is most likely to succeed for the 21st century? 
Featured in Film festivals in 2015 including Sundance, TriBeca, Seattle, Dallas...

"I have not seen a clearer examination of the underlying assumptions about the real skills students need to succeed in today’s world."  Jordan Ronson, NYC English teacher, The Bronx High School of Science


"Incredible! It is the best explanation I have seen of what the issues are with education in America. I have not been this excited about the future of education in a very long time."  Craig Mueller, Retired School Administrator


"This movie brilliantly tells a story every community needs to hear. It shows us how reinventing our approach to education can make every student an independent, lifelong learner fully prepared for today's challenges and opportunities." Mark Lang, Charter Partners Institute
results.name: See "Most Likely to Succeed" at First Friday Films: Documentaries with Meaning

venue.name: Dennis P. McHugh Piermont Public Library

results.description:
Hands down the best thing about Paper Moon is 9 year old Tatum O’Neal, who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her efforts. And doing that in a movie starring fellow nominee Madeleine Kahn as Miss Trixie Delight is quite an achievement.

Ms. O’Neal stars opposite her real life father Ryan O’Neal, who may or may not be her father on screen. Young Addie Loggins is orphaned with nobody to take care of her except some relatives in distant St. Louis. Travelling bible salesman/swindler Moses Pray shows up at the funeral, offers to take young Addie to her people, and they’re off.  Cigarette smoking cussing Addie proves to be quite a help to her possible father’s penny-ante hijinks. The entrance of love interest for Moses Miss Trixie Delight causes the kid to scheme to break up the pair. A chance encounter with a bootlegger and his twin brother the sheriff triggers a madcap series of adventures and hair raising escapes.

Shot on location in Kansas and Missouri in gorgeous black and white.  Director Peter Bogdanovich and cinematographer Laszlo Kovacs evoke the stark and beautiful palette of the dustbowl. Contrast the look with the warmth and humanity of winning performances by a terrific cast and you have a cinematic triumph.
results.name: Piermont Library - 1st Friday Movie

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup included Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), Lenny Marcus (Comedy Central), DC Benny (Last Comic, NBC), JP Justice.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
Programming Languages Shootout


An ACGNJ Special Event facilitated by Bruce Arnold

The Programming Languages Shootout is an annual event for members to show-off their favorite programming language.


RULES:  Each speaker will have 15 minutes (or so) to describe and demonstrate their favorite computer language (we are  hoping to get at least six volunteers).  Languages can be new or old.  Believe-it-or-not, there exists a Windows version of Fortran!  Please ask your friends and neighbors to join us!


The 15-minute talks should show the basics, as well as some of the features, of the language.  An example should be included.  There will also be time for a question-and-answer period.

This topic is a "no-brainer" for experienced computer users, but the less experienced as well as the younger crowd really don't appreciate just how apps, applications, games, browsers, etc. are actually created.

Contact Information:

ACGN C/C++ Users Group Leader


Bruce Arnold, [masked]

We are trying out a new venue.  Everyday Gourmet Cafe on Lex.  When you go inside look for a staircase going up, there is a bar on the second floor and thats where we will be.  Hope to see all of you there.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Continuing Momentum) w/ Laura and Shawn
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Creative Musicality) w/ Odysseus and Naomi 
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Stan

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Creative Musicality
There are dance moves, there are recognizable chord structures, but how do you know what goes where in your dance? Should you be dancing in breakaway with large, powerful moves? Or in close embrace, with small, subtle movement? This series, besides just exploring your creative side of dancing, is to get you to start training your ears to truly listen to the music and all of its components. Join us for an entire month exploring different types of blues music and how to use the music to inform your musical choices.


This Week: Finding Creativity
Creative musicality is letting the song drive how you dance with your partner. Join us to explore how the emotions and intentions behind the music can transform your dance.


Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 40 to 100 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
