results.description:
Slow pace, total hike about 12 miles and 6 hours.

First part, walking to the Andrew Freedman Home Open House and eating lunch, about 5 miles and 3 hours; second part, walking to Randalls Island then back to Manhattan over the pedestrian bridge, about 7 miles and 3 hours, with easy drop off points after the first part.

We will start at the A,B,C,D station at 145th Street and St. Nicholas Avenue in Manhattan then walk east across the 145th Street Bridge into the Bronx. If you want to meet us in the Bronx, be at East 150th Street under the Major Deegan Expressway at the entrance to Mill Pond Park by 11:30 a.m.

We'll walk north along the Harlem River through Mill Pond Park, cross through the Metro-North Station to Macombs Dam Park, pass by Yankee Stadium, view the Lorelei Fountain in Joyce Kilmer Park, then reach the Andrew Freedman Home Open House.

The Home was built as a retirement home for wealthy people who had lost their fortune, from a bequest by Andrew Freedman, a contractor who got wealthy building the IRT subway and almost lost his fortune during the Panic of 1907 and worried how wealthy people who lost their fortune would live out their days. It is now a community center and includes artist studios.

We will spend about two hours at the Home, tour the home, view art exhibits and eat lunch. Bring your own lunch, there will be tables set up in the Pool Room to eat and coffee, beverages and snacks available for purchase. Admission to the Open House is free but a small donation would be appreciated and well-used by the center.

Here is a link to the event page: Andrew Freedman Home Open House

Next, we will cross the street and view the Martin Wong exhibit at the Bronx Museum of Art (free admission). We visited this exhibit in December and will only stay a half hour. Here is a link to the exhibit: Martin Wong: Human Instamatic. Here is a link to a review of the exhibit: Martin Wong, an Urban Visionary with a Hungry Eye

We'll continue south on the Grand Concourse, walk through Franz Sigel Park and view the Shahn murals in the Post Office at East 149th Street.

At this point, 4, 2, 5 and D lines are available along the Grand Concourse if you don't want to walk back to Manhattan.

The walk will continue south on the Grand Concourse to 138th Street, go east on 138th, south on Lincoln Avenue, then east along Bruckner Boulevard and 133rd Street to the Randalls Island Connector and south across Randalls Island to the pedestrian bridge at 103rd Street, then south along the East River to 96th Street and finally west along 96th Street to Lexington Avenue for the 6 train.

Meet: 11:00 a.m. in front of the Capital One Bank at the northeast corner of 145th Street and St. Nicholas Avenue outside the A,B,C,D station in Manhattan. Note that the B train does not run on weekends.


Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Andrew Freedman Home and Randalls Island

This is an open house and introduction to Lyndhurst Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth.

At Lyndhurst Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection.

Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom!

If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 306 Ridge Rd, Lyndhurst, NJ 07071. Our meditation center is located across the stress from Wendy's. You can park in the front and additional free parking is located in the rear of the building. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accommodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Lyndhurst Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Lyndhurst Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction.

results.description:
Singles and Family Event

Don’t miss the annual Maple Sugar Festival  on Saturday, March 5 from 12 noon to 4 p.m. Head outside and watch steam billow from the evaporator, and become engulfed in the sweet smell of maple sugar. See maple cream making first hand and taste the final product. Enjoy a variety of crafts and games, and maple snow cones.Bring your friends and family and take a fascinating guided ‘Hike Through Maple Sugaring History,’ to discover how sugaring has changed since it was started by the Native Americans hundreds of years ago. Admission for the Maple Sugar Festival is $4 per person age 3 and up. The event is held rain or shine. For more information and directions to the Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, visit morrisparks.net or call 973.635.6629. 

Parking:  Parking is at Chatham Presbyterian Church across the street.  There will be a shuttle bus going back and forth.  If we miss you in the parking lot, Donna will be there at 11:40 a.m., take the shuttle and the group will meet at the bench outside of the Education Center.    Donna will be waiting by the bench.  Be sure to take cell phones with you.  You pay the fee for the festival inside the building.


$2 Meetup Fee applies to help offset the Organizer's annual Meetup Fees of $180 a year.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

The Sword Coast is under siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

results.description:
Enjoy new and classic family-friendly short films, engaging discussions, and suggestions for follow-up activities in the Museum’s galleries. This program is for individual families of up to two adults and up to three kids.

Tickets: Free tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-served basis starting at 10:00 a.m. on the day of the program at the reception desk in the Education and Research Building, at 4 West 54th Street. Tickets are also distributed at the information desk in the Museum’s main lobby.

Rosie's World – Gone Away. 1999. Scotland. Directed by Lynn Wiseman. Rosie is eight years old. When her best friend Sean moves away, Rosie must come to terms with the sudden change in her life. 9 min.

The Time-Out Chair. 2002. USA. Directed by Josh Selig. A young girl leaves her preschool classroom to explore New York’s East Village, dragging her time-out chair behind her. 6 min.

Adventures of Owen. 2010. Canada. Directed by David Cadiz. Owen, a socially awkward young boy, finds he can express himself through his drawings of Spaceman X and his adventures on an alien world. As he faces the realities of a demanding household and bullying classmates, he comes to realize what is important. 14 min.

results.description:
Join the amazingly talented Conde Nast graphic designer/illustrator, Leonard Cadiente for a four hour drawing intensive!

"Leonard is an excellent instructor, building upon each step of the lesson. It was amazing to see everyone's progress during each critique. The final illustrations were fantastic. Great class!" - student testimonial


Leonard will teach the technique he uses to draw the amazing images below. If you have ever been to one of our drawing sessions you know Leonard's work always draws a crowd, so we decided to offer a workshop for people to learn this technique. 


Attendees should be prepared to work for the entire session with very limited breaks. There will be a live model starting in leotards and adding draped clothes as we progress. 

This intensive session is for people with at least some drawing experience (email me if you have questions). It is great for people who are currently studying drawing and want an intensive workshop to push them forward. 

The amazing room we work in!

Supply requirement are a 14x17 pad that you can see through: Marker Bristol, tracing or vellum. Any drawing medium they're comfortable to draw with. 


Classical music will be played during the session.

Leonard Cadiente is a graduate of Parsons School of Design majoring in Fashion Illustration.

He has been a graphic designer at Conde Nast Publications for over 35 years and has done extensive freelance illustrations while there. 

He has illustrated for Bloomingdales and many publications and fashion houses. 

"It was in my senior year At Parsons that my talent as an illustrator blossomed. The most influential of all my instructors was Barbara "Bobbie" Perlman. Everyone of my peers who had her were very much influenced by her technique. She taught you how to really draw. My "technique" of drawing is rooted on her teachings."  - Leonard
results.name: Intensive Drawing Workshop for Figure and Fashion

results.description:
Join me on one of my favorite hikes in the Catskills!

_______

Catskill 3500 Series - Panther Mountain via Giant Ledge

Catskill 3500 Club

This peak must be climbed twice (at least once in winter) for membership in the Catskill 3500 Club. 


Total Mileage: 6.6 miles
Total Elevation Gain: 2000 feet
Estimated Hike Time:[masked] hours
Special Gear / Requirements Food/water as much as you feel is appropriate, first aid, insulating and waterproofing layers, trail conference map #142, camera!


Who's Organizing?
 Charlotte [masked] - no texts/calls prior to the final 24 hours please

Meetup Times and Locations:
 March 5, Saturday, hike starts at noon.

_______________________________________________

Getting there: Take the New York State Thruway to exit 19: Kingston.  Keep right after the toll for Route 28 west.  Follow Route 28 almost 31 miles to Big Indian and turn left on County Road 47.  Take County Road 47 just over 7 miles and park on the right at the hairpin turn.

Route description: 6.6 miles distance, 2000 feet of total elevation gain.  We go up the yellow trail a short way to a junction at the ridge line.  Turn left and take the blue trail over Giant Ledge (big views!) and then slightly down before the final climb to Panther.  Back the way we came.

Panther is one of the four 3500'+ Catskill mountains that must be climbed twice (once in winter) to gain entrance to the Catskill 3500 Club.

The DEC Limits group sizes in the Slide Mountain Wilderness to 20.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

-----------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

3rd Season 

March 5th through 6th 2016﻿

After a successful first go at it in 2015, filmmakers Chris J. Cullen and Chris Capaci have returned for their third edition! We have been doing film series events at the Brightside Tavern and decided to turn it into a one day shorts film festival.  And now we've expanded to a second evening, showcasing student short films!

As always we are celebrating the short film in many different categories on two screens with a fun award show at the end of the night. We wanted to make a small shorts fest in Jersey City at a great venue where people can meet up, screen their films and celebrate their work.


Also, we are pleased to reveal the March 2016 Festival's Achievement awards: Director Maurice Paramore the NJ filmmaker award.  And actor Scott Schiaffo from the short film Sender, The Puppet Apocalypse and of course that small indie movie known as Clerks, as well as the first film Chris J. Come spend an afternoon learning how to understand men and be a better partner.


3 topics in one afternoon to transform the way you relate to men!


Get a taste of the Queen's Code workshop.


Learn How to Listen to Men

This can change every single interaction you have with every man.  Learn a new way to listen that gets men to open up to you and share their values with you. Learn common mistakes women make when talking to men. 


Demystify Chemistry and the Effects of Attraction

Men have two types of attraction to women. Learn how to attract the type that gets you the relationship you want. Learn what to do when you are strongly attracted to a man. Learn the things women do to turn men off. Learn what causes chemistry, how it affects us, and what to do about it. 


Effects of Criticism and How You Motivate Men

Criticism affects men and women differently. Learn the biggest thing we do to cause distance and a decrease in participation and effort.

Space is LIMITED. Please RSVP to grab your seat.

RSVP Deadline is Fri, March 4 at noon.

results.description:
Merchant's House Tour - 1:00pm - 2:00 pm
Happy Hour Special: 2 beers for $5.50 @ McSorley's Old Ale House (2:30 - on)

“Manhattan’s Most Haunted House” — The New York Times 


Some say the Tredwell's, who lived in this house for nearly 100 years, are still here.

Gertrude Tredwell, in particular, is thought to be watching over her family home. Born in an upstairs bedroom in 1840, the youngest of the Tredwells’ eight children, Gertrude never married and lived her entire life here until she died, at the age of 93, in 1933. She was the last member of the family to occupy the house.

Since the 1930s, when the house opened to the public as a museum, strange and inexplicable happenings have been reported – sounds, sightings, smells – by staff, volunteers, visitors, neighbors, even passersby.
results.name: BKPS Investigates: Merchant's House Museum

results.description:
Unravel the mysteries of Ravenloft® 
in this dread adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game

Under raging storm clouds, the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich stands silhouetted against the ancient walls of Castle Ravenloft. Rumbling thunder pounds the castle spires. The wind’s howling increases as he turns his gaze down toward the village of Barovia. Far below, yet not beyond his keen eyesight, a party of adventurers has just entered his domain. Strahd’s face forms the barest hint of a smile as his dark plan unfolds. He knew they were coming, and he knows why they came; all according to his plan. A lightning flash rips through the darkness, but Strahd is gone. Only the howling of the wind fills the midnight air. The master of Castle Ravenloft is having guests for dinner—and you are invited.


Join us for the first Curse of Strahd Launch Event in New York City.

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-rare-look-inside-the-historic-academy-mansion-tickets-22292435274?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a rare look inside the historic Academy Mansion, a 26,000 square foot limestone and marble home built in 1921 just steps away from Central Park.

Originally built for William Ziegler, Jr., heir to the Royal Baking Powder Company, the Academy Mansion has also served as the home for Norman Bailey Woolworth and the New York Academy of Sciences. After the Academy of Sciences moved to their current downtown location in 2005, the Academy Mansion has been used as a location for film and photo shoots, charitable events, fashion shows, weddings, and parties.

Our experience through the beautiful five floor home designed by architect Frederick Sterner will include a historical background of the mansion, a visit to the preserved and repurposed rooms, and a discussion around how the mansion is used for commercial photo shoots today. 

After the tour, we'll get food and drinks in the neighborhood!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Rare Look Inside the Historic Academy Mansion

results.description:
“It is not how much we have but how much we enjoy that makes [us happy].”


                                                                   -Charles Spurgeon

Happy to Discuss this Topic Together:


One definition of happiness proffered online is: “A mental or emotional state of well-being, defined by positive or pleasant emotions ranging from contentment to intense joy.” This definition can vary depending on who is considering happiness and what academic fields are studying this phenomenon: biological, psychological, religious, philosophical, etc.  Currently, there’s a lot of research on what happiness is and how it might be attained.  There’s an emerging science around these kinds of questions about happiness. 

For one afternoon, we will consider what happiness might be, how it might be possible to attain (or maintain), and whether its attainability is possible.  We will consider the two components of the headline question above, both independently and in relation to one another.  We will consider personal anecdotes, scientific findings, and the wisdom of the ages: What have the great thinkers of the past (and present) said about happiness and how it can be attained? 

I’d be very happy if you could all join us for this discussion. 

About the Moderator:

Rolando is an educator of educators.  He works with teachers from the four major disciplines—Math, Science, English, and History—to craft, hone, and assess their pedagogical practices.  He has hosted other discussion groups on Meetup on reasoning and truth, self-understanding, self-deception, how discussions affect our lives, whether there is compelling evidence for the existence of God.  In his spare time, he enjoys reading, writing, and ruminating on what happiness is. . .

results.description:
Storytelling is an empowering and enriching tool for building confidence, self-awareness and creativity. This is a 3-week workshop to EMPOWER you to tell your STORY, with your own VOICE, in your own WAY. 

Did you know that public speaking is one of the biggest fears next to death? So, it’s no surprise that many people have a difficult time expressing and articulating their thoughts, feelings and opinions in front of an audience, whether it be an audience of one or one hundred. 

• Are you looking to enhance your ability to speak more effectively?

• Have you had a difficult time engaging in conversations with others in social gatherings?

• Are you a little shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

• Are you a professional hoping to be more confident during work meetings and in interactions with co-workers? 

In this class you will obtain that and a whole lot more! I'm confident that you will leave more knowledgeable, self-confident, motivated and enthusiastic, to tackle the challenges of daily life, whether at work or in your personal life. 

This workshop is designed with interactive activities to teach the basics of good storytelling. You will learn how to create fun, engaging, and stimulating stories, and have a chance to practice speaking and sharing those stories with personalized feedback.

YOU WILL LEARN:

•  How to tell your story effectively

• How to engage in personal practices that will assist you in building your confidence

• How to make any story interesting and engaging by adding your own uniqueness

• Why your story is important

• How learning to craft your story leads to more confidence, freedom and empowerment

WHO IS THIS CLASS IS FOR? 

Anyone who wants to strengthen their skills in storytelling to transform themselves in social interactions, work presentations, and build overall confidence when engaging with others

LOGISTICS:


• Please bring water.


• Door closes at 1:15pm, so please get there before then or else you might be locked out.

CLASS DATES:

• Workshop 1: Saturday, Feb 27


• Workshop 2: Saturday, Mar 5


• Workshop 3: Saturday, Mar 12

INSTRUCTOR:

Pasha Cook is a life and personal development coach. She facilitates athlete transition workshops, leadership development trainings, and character-building seminars. She has a mission to empower others with her encouraging message, “Discovering Your Inner Champion.” 


Learn more about Pasha at pashacook.com.
results.name: Storytelling Workshop: Your Story, Your Voice, Your Way (3-WEEK SERIES)

results.description:
Craft Party at Blythedale Children's Hospital!

Come join us in a fun filled day spreading cheer and smiles to the kids at Blythdale Children's Hospital.  This event is incredibly fulfilling for volunteers and patients alike.  =)  We will hang out with the kids and help them complete a craft project, followed by snacks and sweet treats!  

The hospital limits these group hosted events to 1.5 hrs, so the party will take place from 1:30pm to 3:00pm.  We will arrive 30 min early at 1:00pm to setup, and stay until 3:30 afterwards just to tidy up the room.  =) 

Where does my $11 go?

≈ $5 towards the cost of the food

≈ $5 towards the cost of craft supplies

≈ $1 online transaction fee


Volunteers must be healthy and over the age of 18.
results.how_to_find_us: Please bring a photo ID.  We will meet in the lobby at 1:00pm
results.name: Craft Party at Blythedale Children's Hospital

results.description:
We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike
results.how_to_find_us: Ring the bell for Battery Dance and we'll buzz you up.
results.name: Saturday Fencing 1pm Battery Dance

results.description:
RALLY, MARCH AND CELEBRATE!
INTERNATIONAL WORKING WOMEN'S DAY, Sat. 3/5/16
                          (founded March 8, 1910)

Come get your activist groove on before heading out to the Brooklyn Museum for the evening event!

1:00 - 1:30 Rally at Harriet Tubman Statue @ 122nd St. and St. Nicholas Blvd (aka Frederick Douglass Blvd.)


1:30 – Step off for march

FOLLOWED BY:
A Celebration of Puerto Rican Women: Today, Tomorrow, and Always @ 4 pm 109 Gallery, 215 E. 99th St. in El Barrio ($10 donation) facebook.com/events/[masked]

All genders and gender preferences are welcome.

Bring your banners, signs and noise makers.

RSVP if you need childcare at:
[masked] by Monday Feb. 29.

facebook.com/events/[masked]/

Sponsored by International Working Women’s Coalition


IWWD Coalition’s “Can We Live” 10-point Program of Action:

Healthy food

Jobs, Not Jails — Union Rights; Defend public workers; a livable wage and/or income; social security; End discrimination based on age, nationality, disability; pay equity

Healthcare for All — Reproductive justice; Hands off Medicare and Medicaid

Free Quality Education from the Cradle to the Grave

Housing is a Human Right— No foreclosures & evictions, no utility shut-offs, end homelessness

Clean Environment

Legalization, Not Deportation, Unite families; End ICE raids

 End Domestic & State Violence Against Women — Stop sexual exploitation, trafficking & police brutality; Restore safe houses

 Oppose Imperialist War—Stop ALL violence against women in the military and in occupied lands; Bring the troops home

Full rights for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer People
results.name: International Working Women's Day: Rally, March and Celebrate! Sat. 3/5

results.description:
Do you have health and fitness goals? Have you decided to embark upon a weight loss journey? Perhaps you "know what to do" to meet your goals, but need support, inspiration, and encouragement through goal setting and weight check-ins.

Join us at Riverdale Diner, where we will chat, snack, and plan future accountability/support meetings. 

***Note: Moss Cafe (the original location) has changed its schedule and is closed on Saturdays. Riverdale Diner does offer some healthful options and meeting there gives us the opportunity to discuss how to choose healthy food when dining out at non-organic restaurants!

This is an initial meeting to introduce ourselves to one another and set specific goals toward leading a healthier lifestyle!
results.name: Weight Loss/Fitness Goal Setting Meet and Greet

group.name: Friends for Wellness in The Bronx and NYC

results.description:
Happy New Year and welcome to our new officially monthly Singles Bowling Meet and Greet/Battle of the Sexes for all  members of the NYC Black/African American/Caribbean Singles Meetup. 

This event is in partnership with the New York Black Entrepreneurs Network and other meetup groups. We bowl, eat and drink and most of all have fun meeting new people. This has always been a packed event so please arrive early to get your space on the bowling lane.

"There will be limited Complimentary Appetizers on a first come first served (while supplies last) bases from 1pm to 2pm. Courtesy New York Black Expo and Black Singles Magazine." Mark Anthony Jenkins


Come on out to enjoy and fellowship with other single members of our meetup group! Bring your A, B and C game!

Event starts promptly 1pm (Do not be late) and ends at 4pm.

Here are the prices to bowl at Bowlmor Lanes in Times Square:

$25.00 (cash) total for a frame of 10 games and shoes per person to bowl. 

$20.00 (cash) If you have your own OFFICIAL bowling shoes

Teams will be created upon your arrival at 1pm

Reminder: Please bring $25.00 cash to cover cost of bowling with our group and if you have your own official bowling shoes it's $20.00 cash to bowl with us. There are ATM's on the premise. 

Please confirm your RSVP attendance by emailing your name and guest names to [masked] or [masked]. Your name(s) will be placed on Bowling Roster Form when you arrive and are PAID IN FULL to bowl with us.

FYI...Guys and Gentleman.....If you want to meet beautiful Black Women that bowl then I encourage you to not only to show up early but to bring a male friend with you and lets get our game on. Yes Battle of the Sexes!!!!!


Thanks for your support in advance.

Mark Anthony Jenkins

Meetup Organizer

[masked]
results.name: Singles Bowling Meet & Greet at Bowlmor Lanes ($25.00 per person)

group.name: NYC Black /African American / Caribbean Singles Events

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!
results.name: Beginner Salsa Dancing

group.name: Spanish, Salsa, and Tango at El Taller!

results.description:
AAT in Dubai Q&A Phone Conference 

I know.. despite the information that has already been presented $2,350 is a lot of money to commit to any one thing. You may still have questions that you want answered, concerns that you want addressed, or you just want to be able to talk to the person that is going to be organizing all of this. 

I understand, and I would like you to join us on one of our many conference calls. 

Dial in Info:  [masked]

Talking Points

- What is AAT all about?

         - How do you approach each trip?

         - What if I'm traveling alone? How do I get a roommate?

         - What should I expect of AAT? 

         - What does AAT expect of me?

- What should I know about Dubai before going?

Please come prepared with any unanswered questions! 

If this conference call is full, please select another one!
results.name: AAT in Dubai Q&A Phone Conference

venue.name: PEAK Performing Arts Center (Formerly The Viibe Dance Center)

results.description:
Join us tomorrow to put a little SALSA in your life. 

Each and every saturday we have a little salsa for all ages and all levels. 

• Latin Kids Ensemble: 1-2PM 

Kid's are welcome to join the "Latin Kids Ensemble" from 1-2pm.  In this class kids learn about Latin Culture and its rhythm.  We focus on teaching them the roots of music and how to feel it in their souls. 

• Salsa Level 1: 2-3PM

Two left feet? Never danced before? Want to learn how to salsa? Come join us.. No experience necessary, and no partner needed. Just bring your dancing shoes, and your positive energy y VAMOS A BAILAR!!! WHEPPA!!!

• Salsa Level 2: 3-4PM 

Salsa Level 2 requires you to have previous salsa experience. You should know the fundamentals of the basics, and an open mind to learn.  In this class we will cover footwork, partner-work, body movement, spinning, and styling techniques.  


***Note: Please wear comfy attire. WE WILL BE HAVING A NICE SALSA WORKOUT!!!
results.name: Salsita Saturday's

group.name: Peak Latin Dancing group in Bergen County, (Ridgefield) NJ

results.description:
The NYSC invites you to join us to our monthly Women’s circle where we honor your feelings, honor your soul and call upon your divine being to help you move through this sacred time. Within the circle, women unite to empower their voices, enhance their courage, reinforce their compassion, and connect with their wisdom. We meditate, play music to access our heart's knowledge, remember our mothers and grandmas, share, and enjoy sisterhood! This circle is open to all traditions and levels, and beginners are especially encouraged to attend.
Please arrive on time and bring water to drink, a drum or rattle (you may borrow one at the event), pen & notepad, a scarf, and feel free to bring objects that are connected to your spiritual power. Suggested donation: $20 For more info visit http://www.nyshamaniccircle.org/womens-circle or email [masked] with questions.

If you need to contact us on Saturday, please feel free to email us.


"When women gather, Pachamama heals!"
results.name: NYSC Women's Circle!

results.description:
As featured by ABC News and Time Out New York, explore what lies beneath the streets of the Big Apple for this warmer, wintertime edition of The Amazing New York Scavenger Hunt. 

This fast-paced three-hour event is a hybrid scavenger hunt-obstacle course where you'll experience the fun & excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line. 


Each member of the winning group receives a New York City gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

*GET TICKETS HERE ($25 early bird, price will go up to $35) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0130PM

*No tickets sold at door. Must Prepay. 75+ members attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 


What to expect: 


• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed in a group or you can sign up with friends.  

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0130PM

*Prepay only. No tickets sold at door. 

Who can attend? All are welcome. Not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 


What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes.


What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? It's underground so the race still goes on. 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 


Where do I get a ticket? Must prepay to attend. Tickets not sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing UNDERGROUND Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

You can come alone and be placed in a group or you can sign up with friends.  

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0130PM

*Prepay only. No tickets sold at door. 

Who can attend? All are welcome. Not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? It's underground so the race still goes on. 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 

Where do I get a ticket? Must prepay to attend. Tickets not sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out. PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Mar-05-2016_at_0130PM

Always wanted to take a tango class, but don’t have the time for regular lessons? Ready to dive in to the elegance and passion of one of the world’s oldest dances? With our Beginners Crash Course, you can challenge yourself to learn many of the basics of tango in just one day. Take your first steps, and then learn basic figures with confidence and poise. Follow up two hours of class with two hours dancing socially with staff and students at our practica. We guarantee that by the time the crash course is complete, you will be confident, dancing, and having fun!

No partner needed, no tango experience required. Leather soled shoes are required.

Program: Fundamentals, posture, embrace, feet positions, musicality, connection, navigation, Caja continuada, Baldoza, paso basico, decorations, Charleston, Ocho cortado and its variations. Etiquette at milongas (social dancing).

Classes at Pearl Studios, 500 8th ave, 12th fl.

Reserve here in advance and save $5! $35 in advance, $40 at the door.

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Saturday March 05, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO".  THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

HAVE EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING. PLEASE DRESS PROPERLY FOR THE WINTER CONDITIONS.

I also scheduled this same walk on Sunday, March 6th.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will comment on some things (the architecture and social history of some of the buildings) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. We will be stopping at a number of points of interest. (IF YOU DON'T LIKE THIS STOPPING, THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU.) This walk is about 2 1/2 to 3 miles and moderate paced. 

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. 

Description: In Tribeca, we'll discuss industrial architecture/artifacts; the humanitarian Cocoanut King; the House of Relief's unusual way to treat patients; and the lost art of whalebone cutting. Later in the Civic Center area, we'll talk about the profitable business of corrupt politicians; skyscrapers erected by mighty corporations; a sculptor who has angered people from the late 19th century to the present; how to get a decent-paying job at a "dime museum on the Bowery; and so on.


Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place: The meeting time is (after lunch) 2:00 PM. The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes and Noble Bookstore/Bed, Bath & Beyond, which are located at 97 Warren Street, between Greenwich Street and West Street. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble Bookstore or Bed, Bath & Beyond. There will be limited places to stop for a restroom along the way.

Transportation: Take the 1, 2, or 3 subway train to Chambers St (about 2 blocks away) or the A or C subway train to Chambers St (about 3 blocks away).

Finishing Time/Place: The walk will finish about 4:45 PM at Fulton Street and Broadway. This is near the Fulton Street subway station, a major transportation hub, which has a number of subway lines.

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.

Located in New England, the Walter Baker & Company's regional headquarters was in the Lower West Side (Tribeca). (Sources Overland Monthly Magazine, January, 1919/The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, January 23, 1908)

The words “root beer” initially caused outrage among the 19th century Temperance Movement, but root beer firms began to advertise root beer as the “temperance drink,” arguing that it had no alcohol and was a great alternative to alcoholic beverages or contaminated water. Knapp's Root Beer Extract Company was located in the Lower West Side (Tribeca). (Sources The Evening World, July 18, 1893/The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, May 16, 1891)

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>

results.description:
Bi-Perspective is the longest-running social, discussion and support group for ALL bisexual/non-monosexual, queer-identified and questioning people meeting in the New York City area.

Monthly meetings are held on the 1st Saturday of every month from 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM at the LGBT Community Center, followed by a convivial Coffee & Desert at a nearby local restaurant. The group provides a warm & friendly, welcoming, caring, SAFE, non-discriminatory environment for everyone who lives, works or plays in the New York City area.

Come visit and share your Feelings, Hopes and Dreams as well as your Fears, Concerns and Uncertainties with us. And of course, Joy and Laughter are always welcome at our meetings too! Bi-Perspective, a great way to meet others from the community and to make new friends in the New York area.

$5 (more if/less if) suggested donation to help defray room-rental cost

"Whereas Wicked may have been the most successful musical of the first decade of the 21st century, in this century's second decade, Daddy Long Legs will become much more deeply adored and cherished." –The Huffington Post

"An enchanting new musical with an exquisite score. An absolute charmer that's perfect for date night and also suitable for the whole family." -BroadwayWorld

Pick Up Tickets

We will meet at 2:00 outside of the theater. There will be a representative with a sign that says, "Meetup."


https://youtu.be/o4uILqlYfhc

Daddy Long Legs is a musical about a young orphan named Jerusha, whose college education is sponsored anonymously by a wealthy benefactor- the only rule being that Jerusha must write her benefactor once a month. Knowing nothing about him, Jerusha names her benefactor Daddy Long Legs, as she once saw the shadows of his long legs. This musical is a sweet, intimate love story that has spoken audiences all over the world. Directed by Les Miserables director John Caird and starring husband and wife team Megan McGinnis (Les Miserables, Little Women) and  Adam Halpin (Dogfight, Rent), this production is sure to move your whole family.

results.description:
This is my second year attending this valuable program. Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome. The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14,21; Dec. 5, 12 (Completed)
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30 (Completed)
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5
The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc and bring a lock for the lockers.
Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass.

DIRECTIONS- From 138th St. head west and make a left onto 12th Ave., Take the 1st right beneath the West Side Hwy (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway in and around, curve left and make a hard left U-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator to get to the park on the upper level walk to the pool area. Make sure you have a parking permit in your car window. Please car pool as parking is limited.

See Nov. 21, 2015 for additional information
results.name: Volunteer, learn new skills and kayak at the NY Community Kayak Program.

results.description:
You are invited on Saturday, March 5, 2016 at 3:00 PM to the Masonic Philosophical Society for our next hosted discussion and study. Each month a different topic, ranging from philosophy and science to religion and metaphysics, is discussed and debated. This group, which is open to the public, is where non-members can learn more about Freemasonry, as well as meet local Freemasons.

Study Topic
March's topic will be conducted by Brother Anouk van Opstal on a study of Freemasonry: "Symbols: philosophical and intellectual speculations or tools of daily life?" After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Whether we realize it or not, we are surrounded by symbols on our daily lives. But what are symbols? And more importantly are we still able to decipher them and what do they mean to us? Our society privileges the usage of the scientific method to explain our Universe and its working to us. Although it has assisted in the development of great discoveries and advances it is evident that it does not allow space for the imaginary and the symbolic. We are becoming more and more aware that our Universe, just like our lives, are more complex than science can explain. Is it possible to have another perspective and have a more complex thinking that allows for symbolic thinking? It is no secret that Freemasonry is based on rituals and symbols so what is its contribution in this regard?

Directions:
[masked]th Ave Whitestone, NY 11357

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety

Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.co-masonry.org
results.name: Symbols: philosophical and intellectual speculations or tools of daily life?

group.name: Freemasonry for Men and Women in New York City

ARE Center NYC

Saturday March 5th, 3-5 pm


Medical Intuition


All Illnesses have a frequency and vibration to them. Similarly, thoughts, emotions, events etc. also reflect a vibration. The energy field of every living thing contains cellular memory embedded in the core of its very existence. This cellular memory holds those patterns in place until a shift occurs, whether conscious or not. Everything we experience has a ripple effect as we are all interconnected.In this class we will learn about our own ailments through palpation on an energetic level, and work on tracking their origins, their projections, and their present state of manifestation. By doing so, the shifts will become more conscious then unconscious, and we can learn to be more in control of how to maintain balance when we are struggling physically. Some audience members will be given mini “readings” as we learn how to be more present with the energies within and around us.


Cost: $35; Members save 15%


Laura Silvana Aversano is a medical intuitive and ancestral empath with an international clientele. Her written works include The Divine Nature of Plants, The Light of God, Plant Spirit Journey and Spiritwalker, The Beginning. You can read more about her work at <a>www.LauraAversano.com</a>

results.description:
This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers. Depending on how many people sign up to come and to share their work at this meeting, we will divide the group into two tables. A "fiction writers" table and a "non-fiction writers" table.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.


Here is how we will divide the tables if needed:

1) Fiction writers: Genres covered are literary/upscale/art fiction, poetry, all kinds of mysteries, speculative fiction (fantasy, urban fantasy, horror and sci-fi), chick lit, women fiction, romance (all kinds, including historical, regent, sexy and erotica), western.


2) Non-fiction writers: Genres covered are all kids of non-fiction, autobiographies and memoires, academic non-fiction, news articles, blogs, poetry, non-fiction screenplays etc.

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

If you are a novice or love art, our Chelsea Art Gallery Tours are a fun and casual way to explore a great part of the city while socializing and making new friends and connections.

With over 300 art galleries in Chelsea, our Gallery Tour  Led by Rafael Risemberg with a Ph.D. in arts education  finds the most innovative art, and leads you on an insightful, entertaining and affordable journey through the contemporary art scene.  Rafael explains the art in ways that makes the experience meaningful to those who don’t know a lot about art as well as those who do.

Highlights of this ALL-NEW tour: (1) a Middle Eastern artist’s ASTONISHINGLY BEAUTIFUL video/ painting hybrids, (2) a female artist’s PROVOCATIVE installations about love, sex and relationships, and (3) an Asian artist’s UTTERLY ORIGINAL constructions unlike any art you’ve ever seen!  These are just 3 of 7 exceptional shows.

Our tours take place RAIN, Snow or SHINE, as we’re indoors over 90% of the time. You will be amazed at how much you will learn and enjoy both the art and the people on the tour!

The group will meet at The Starbucks on West 26th between 10th and 11th prior to the tour.  Following the tour many from the group stay together for a drink or a bite to eat.

Pay $25 when you arrive

DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of the people come to this event on their own to meet new people and check out some cool art.

What do I wear? Dress for the weather.  Be casual and comfortable.

What to expect: We are piggy backing on a larger tour.   We will have 10-15 from our group.  The age range for our people is 20's -40's ( the larger group is 20's - 60's)

How long does it last? about 2 hours

How do I know who is leading the group?  We meet separate from the main tour at starbucks.  Our tour host will have a sign at the bar and you will have a chance to have something to eat or drink before we start the tour.  If you are not hungry just socialize.  When we are finished we walk over together to join the main tour.

results.description:
10v10, 75min game. Pls Arrive early to warm up, and be ready on time.

ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.


It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know - Intermediate level.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.

• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.

•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.

• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.

• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


Payment goes toward field permit, equipment and fees.

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Experience the Whitney’s world renowned collection of modern and contemporary American art in American Sign Language. Join us for a free tour in ASL of The Whitney’s Collection led by expert Deaf educator, Christopher Tester, and accompanied by a voice interpreter. 

The tour begins at 5 pm, with a pre-tour wine and cheese reception from 4–5 pm in the Laurie M. Tisch Education Center.


Admission to the tour and reception is free with RSVP.  To register, click here: https://whitneyedu.wufoo.com/forms/whitney-signs-03052016/

The more than two hundred works on display on the seventh and sixth floors represent a selection of the Whitney Museum of American Art’s collection. Organized in a rough chronological sequence beginning on the seventh floor, the presentation is divided into eleven thematic “chapters.” Each chapter takes its name not from a movement or style but from the title of a work that evokes the section’s animating impulse. The exhibition elaborates some of the themes, ideas, beliefs, and passions that have galvanized American artists in their struggle to work within and against established conventions, often directly engaging their political and social contexts. Works of art across all mediums are displayed together, acknowledging the ways in which artists have engaged various modes of production and dissolved the boundaries between them.

As a collection presentation, the works on view necessarily reflect the Whitney’s record of acquisitions and exhibitions, which constitutes a kind of collective memory—one that represents a range of individual, sometimes conflicting, attitudes toward what American art might be or mean or do at any given moment. Works that have rarely, if ever, been shown appear alongside beloved icons in an effort to unsettle assumptions about the American art canon. The presentation also underscores the difficulty of neatly defining the country’s ethos and inhabitants, a challenge that lies at the heart of the Museum’s commitment to and continually evolving understanding of American art. 


Taken from the Whitney Museum's website. http://whitney.org/Exhibitions/TheWhitneysCollection
results.name: Whitney Signs:  The Whitney's Collection

Please join us for this week's sit at 4pm this afternoon at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair), where a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice.  


The sit leaders alternate each week.  


We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing from the theme Merfolk a legendary people of the sea having human head, trunk, and arms and the tail of a fish, for example mermaid/merman. From generic to unorthodox, today we will be working on turning real sea creatures into a variety of Merfolks.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawings followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

Follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Merfolk

results.description:
Bachata Class-


This is a fun, Level 1 class that begins with the fundamental basics of Bachata dancing!

The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. We will work on proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern for you to use on your next romantic night out!

No experience is needed, and no partner is necessary! 

Participation fee: $15 per person or $50 for 4-week session 

This is a weekly class that is regularly attended, the attendance shown for this event does not reflect the full attendance of the class, space is limited - Please RSVP if you would like to join us! 

Also, please feel free to contact us for information about receiving your first trial class for FREE! 

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site, Spirare Dance Studio.

You can also find us on Facebook, Spirare Dance.
results.how_to_find_us: The studio is located at the end of 41st Ave, off of Bell Blvd, between Donovan's Tavern and the municipal parking lot. Take the LIRR to the Bayside Stop or the Q13 Bus to Bell Blvd/42nd Ave. If driving, there is metered parking in the lot next door.

    I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
